Kan mashakil ja fii beit,</br>Beina rajil wa mara;</br>Mata’kum gum zalaam. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Mata’kum amul mashakil,</br>Seli le Yesu bes;</br>Sheitani jibu mashakil,</br>Fii beina takum. (2x)</br></br>3. Kan inta ma indu iyal,</br>Mata fagidu iman;</br>Allah bi wodi le inta. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Kan Allah bi wodi le ana,</br>Wa inta wogifu fi Rab;</br>Ana amin Huwo Kaman,</br>Bi wodi le inta. (2x)</br></br>4. Mata fekir gali,</br>Ayan goful wilada bitak</br>Ya okti de adu Sheitan. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Seli le Rab Yesu,</br>Wa amin fii Huwo bes;</br>Yesua indu rahma,</br>Bi wodi le inta. (2x)</br>
title: KAN YOM SHEITAN MAA INTA

content: ( Rejoice Isaac. )</br>1. Zaman ta nina de zaman bataal,</br>Intum ya akwana gum min num;</br>Ado Sheitani biga bataal,</br>Bi istamil hata iyal sukar. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Yakwana taalu le Yesu,</br>Keli intum fetis hagiga;</br>Nihaya ta dunia ja,</br>Wori katiya le Yesu. (2x)</br></br>2. Ana bi mejid inta ya Rab,</br>Ana bi wori ajaib taki;</br>Al inta amul fii hayaa tai,</br>An bi guna le inta bes. (2x)</br></br>3. Adu bitai bi waga,</br>Ashan guwa ta Rab Yesu;</br>Keli inta arif Rab you,</br>Bi hakim mini ajil bitak. (2x)</br></br>4. Kan inta geni fii nus nas,</br>Keli inta arif kwes toumon;</br>Adu Sheitani ma bi alabu,</br>Bi geiru hata jena taki. (2x)</br>
title: ZAMAN TA NINA DE ZAMAN BATAAL

content: ( Mugabe Banjamin )</br>1. Baba Allah rasulu Jena Bitou ashani kalisu nasi. (2x)</br>Huwo ja fii dunia nasi, ma rudu kalaam Bitou,</br>Umon selib Huwo fii seliib gal Huwo kabasu nasi.</br></br>Chorus</br>“Illahi, Illahi” – Uwo kore le Abu Bitou min taabu ta nina,</br>“Malu inta sibu ana” – de kulu</br>Ashan ashan katiya ta nina. (2x)</br></br>2. Baad alfein sena inta wa ana gi</br>Asuma kalaam ta Yesu. (2x)</br>Ana ma aruf inta gi kelimu gal sunu le Yesu,</br>Ashan mutu Bitou fii seliib ashani inta wa ana.</br></br>3. Baba Allah ayinu yali bitaki ali rudu inta. (2x)</br>Umon wodi hayaa bitoumon ashani douru wara inta,</br>Kasulu umon maa dom bita Yesu ali kubu fii seliib.</br>
title: BABA ALLAH RASUL JENA BITOU

content: ( Rejoice Isaac. )</br>1. Keli inta wogif gowi le Yesu</br>Messiah,</br>Rabuna nadi inta fii shokol;</br>Keli ana wogif gowi le Yesu </br>Messiah,</br>Rabuna nadi inta fii shokol.(2x)</br></br>2. Ana azu douru ma Yesu Messiah,</br>Rabuna nadi ana fii shokol;</br>Ana azu ruwa maa Yesu Messiah,</br>Rabuna nadi ana fii shokol. (2x)</br></br>3. Keli intum kun harisin fii dunia,</br>Nebi al kizib bi zahir,</br>Fii bara bi kun ze koruf nesiya,</br>Fii dakil huwo ado Sheitan. (2x)</br></br>4. Guna halleluya le Rabi Yesua,</br>Halleluya Messiah bi raja</br>Guna halleluya le Rabi Yesua,</br>Halleluya Messiah bi raja. (2x)</br>
title: KELI INTA WOGIF GOWI

content: ( Kurugu Ismail )</br>1. Yesu mashi fii samawat ‘Hu bi ja tani fii dunia,</br>‘Hu bi ja shilu inta wa ana, ashan geni maa Huwo fi samaa. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Solo: Yesua, a-a-a,</br>Kulu: Yesua, Yesua ‘Hu bi ja;</br>Solo: Yakwana, a-a-a</br>Kulu: Yesua, Yesua ‘Hu bi ja;</br>Solo: Immanuele,</br>Kulu: ‘Hu bi ja tani fii dunia. (2x)</br></br>2. Yesu gali le talamiz Bitou, amshi ‘kum fii kulu al dunia;</br>Amid kulu nas fii isim ta Abu wa Jena,</br>Wa isim ta Roho al Kudus. (2x)</br></br>3. Wa deris ‘hum ashani ihtaram kulu hajaat al ana wori’kum,</br>Wa hagiga ana bi kun maa’kum,</br>Wa lahadi fii nihaya ta zaman. (2x)</br>
title: YESU MASHI FII SAMAWAT

content: ( Rejoice Isaac. )</br>1. Rabi Yesu Huwo kulasa le dunia,</br>Solo: Rabi Yesu Huwo ilaj le dunia. (2x)</br>Kulu:  Rabi Yesu Huwo ilaj le dunia wa</br>kaman kulasa ta dunia. (2x)</br></br>2. Ana biga bi amulu sunu le Yesu,</br>Solo: inta okti bi amulu sunu le Yesu,</br>Kulu: Yesu gumu ana mini,</br>Wodi le ana hayaa jediid. (2x)</br></br>3. content: 1. Ya akwana wa ikwati taali,</br>Kalaam kwes ta injiil fi hina. Abuba, shaabaati taali,</br>Kalaam kwesi ta injiil fii hinak. (2x)</br></br>5. Meskiini, meskiina taali,</br>kalaam kwesi ta injiil fii hinak.(2x)</br>
title: YA AKWANA WA IKWATI

content: ( Kurugu Ismail )</br>1. Rabuna hibu nina kalis,</br>Rasulu Jena Bitou al wahid;</br>Mutu fii seliib ashan nina,</br>‘Na shukuru Allah al fii samaa. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Solo: Alela,</br>Kulu: Nina shukuru Rabuna;</br>Solo: Ta nina,</br>Kulu: Kulu maa geliba al wahid;</br>Solo: Ashani,</br>Kulu: Huwo rasulu Yesua, mutu fii seliib ashan nina. (2x)</br></br>2. Rabuna hibu dunia kulu,</br>‘Hu lisa wodi le umon zaman;</br>Ashani umon bi ihterif,</br>Wa tubu min katiyaat toumon. (2x)</br></br>3. Alela nina fii Yesua,</br>Wa arufu muhaba ta Allah;</br>Le nina ze iyal Bitou,</br>‘Na hibu baad ze iyal ta Allah. (2x)</br>
title: RABUNA HIBU NINA KALIS

content: ( Rejoice Isaac. )</br>1. Ya okti taali le Yesu,</br>Mata sibu jisim le adu Sheitan. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Taali, taali, taali le Yesu. title: YA OKTI TAAL LE YESU

content: ( Rejoice Isaac. )</br>Chorus</br> Rabi rasul Jena ali wahid,</br> Ashan mutu le dunia kulu, (2x)</br> Hagiga dunia ma deir. (3x)</br></br>1. Ya akwana tai matakum nesitu,</br>Haja wahid fii kalaam ta Allah;</br>Ferig mafi le Rabna bein,</br>Wahid yom wa alif sena. (2x)</br></br>3. Keli intum geni nas al kudus,</br>Mata’kum geni  maa nas ta katiya;</br>Istemir raba fii neima ta Allah,</br>Wa hikima Bitou al kudus. (2x)</br>
title: RABI RASUL

content: ( Kurugu Ismail )</br>1. Yesu mashi fii samaa, Huwo bi rija fii dunia;</br>Ashan shilu nasi al rudu, amin fii isim Bitou. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Solo: Zaman, zaman,</br>Kulu: Zaman biga geribu,</br>Solo: zaman kulasa,</br>Kulu: Ta nina biga geriibu. (2x)</br></br>2. title: YESU MASHI FII SAMAA

content: ( Kurugu Ismail )</br>1. Nina kan fi ishakila al kebiir, Allah maa nina,</br>Jibu le’na al salaam wa shukuran le Rabuna. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Muhaba ta Allah fi le Sudani,</br>Iyal ta Sudani, sibu katiya intum bi ligo hayaa fii Yesu. (2x)</br></br>2. Ya iyal ta Rabuna al fii Sudani tuub min katiya.</br>Taali le Yesum intum bi ligo hayaa al kwesi. (2x)</br></br>3. Nina hasa fii kutura ta ayani al ma indu ilaji.</br>Ya Rabuna Abu ta’na taali saidu nina. (2x)</br>
title: NINA KAN FII SHAKILA AL KEBIIR

content: 1. Solo: Yesu gali, keli intum ma fekir,</br>Kulu: Amin fii Rab, wa amin fii ana,</br>Solo: Fii beit Abui, inak mahal fii ketiir,</br>Kulu: Kan ma ze de, ana bi wori’kum. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Nina bi geni maa faraha,</br>Nina maa Yesua;</br>Nina bi guna ma faraha,</br>Maa faraha, maa Yesu fii samaa. (2x)</br></br>2. Solo: Ana mashi salau mahal le intm,</br>Kulu: Ana bi ja tani fii dunia,</br>Solo: Ashan shilu intum maa ana sawa,</br>Kulu: wa geni fii mahal ana fogo.</br>(2x)</br></br>Barathon (Sout bit Rajil):</br>3. Ina fii dunia, ketir mashakil,</br>Mashakil bita mutu, zuruf wa jian;</br>Ayan fogo ketiir, wa hayaa deig,</br>Hayaa wa tab, mala maa lakabata;</br>Lakini fii samaa, inak fii salama,</br>Salama mafi fii dunia.</br></br>Solo: Mafi taabu,</br>Kulu: Mafi taabu fii beit ta Allah,</br>Solo: Mafi zuruf,</br>Kulu: Mafi zuruf fii beit ta Allah</br>Solo: Mafi kore</br>Kulu: Mafi kore fii beit ta Allah,</br>Ille hayaa mala ma faraha.</br>Solo: Mafi ayan,</br>Kulu: Mafi ayan fii beit ta Allah,</br>Solo: Mafi mutu,</br>Kulu: Mafi mutu fii beit ta Allah,</br>Solo: Mafi jian,</br>Kulu: Mafi jian fii beit ta Allah,</br>Ille hayaa mala maa faraha.</br>
title: YESU GAL KELI INTUM MA FEKIR

content: ( Kurugu Ismail )</br>1. Solo: Nasi ketiir fekir sika bita</br>Samaa, uwo bes yau nadi isim ta Rabuna.</br>Kulu: Umon fekir gali sika de’hum ketiir,</br>sala inta  azil wahid inta bi wosuulu fii samaa. content: 1. Seidi Daniele, al kan fii Babele, </br>Zaman jada uwo fii hufra ta usuud;</br>Uwo wogifu, hinak fii hufura,</br>Lakini Rab ja kan saidu uwo. content: 1. Ana bi rahib inta Yesu,</br>Fii geliba bitai yesu;</br>Taali geni fii geliba bitai.</br>(Ana wodi gelba kulu le inta.) x2</br></br>2. Shufu taabu bita Yesu,</br>Shufu mutu Bitou kulu;</br>Rahib Yesu fii geliba bitak,</br>(Huwo bi saidu inta le nihaya). (2x)</br>
title: ANA BI RAHIB INTA YESU

content: Douru maa Yesu! Amen</br>Douru maa Yesu! Amen</br>Douru maa Yesu! Amen</br>Halleluya, Amen.</br>
title: DOURU MAA YESU

content: 1. Allah ta nina, O,O,O, Allah,</br>Allah ta nina wodi le'na Baraka</br></br>2. Yom ta alela O, O, O, Allah,</br>Yom ta alela yom de yom ta Baraka.</br></br>3. Elia kore O, O, O Allah,</br>Elia kore, wodi le’na Baraka.</br>
title: ALLAH TA NINA

content: 1. Taali Nina Limu Fii Juwa Kenisa. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Fii juwa kenisa nina limu maa Rabuna (2x)</br></br>2. Taali nina limu shukuru Rabuna. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Ya mama inta weinu, (2x)</br>Shukuru Rabuna;</br>Ya baba inta weinu,</br>Shukuru Rabuna; (2x)</br>Shababu intum weinu,</br>Shukuru Rabuna.
title: FII JUWA KENISA

content: 1. Rabuna kwes;</br>Rabuna kwesi</br>Rabuna kwes</br>Kuwesi le nina.</br></br>2. Salaam nina ligo;</br>Salaam nina ligo;</br>Salaam nina ligo;</br>Fii isim ta Yesu.</br></br>3. Fii Samaa nina bi ruwa;</br>Fii samaa nina bi ruwa;</br>Fii Sama nina bi urwa,</br>Fii isim ta Yesu.</br></br>4. Fii Samaa nina bi geni;</br>Fii Samaa nina bi geni;</br>Fii Samaa nina bi geni;</br>Fii isim ta Yesu.</br></br>5. Fii Samaa nina bi guna;</br>Fii Samaa nina bi guna;</br>Fii Samaaa nina bi guna;</br>Fii isim ta Yesu.</br>
title: RABUNA KWES

content: 1. Anina guna,</br>Anina guna fii Samaa. (2x)</br></br>2. Farahani mala,</br>Farahan mala fii Samaa. (2x)</br></br>3. Anina nutu,</br>Anina nutu fii Samaa. (2x)</br></br>4. Shakila mafi,</br>Shakila mafi fii Samaa. (2x)</br></br>5. Sijara mafi,</br>Sijara mafi fii Samaa. (2x)
title: ANINA GUNA

content: Solo: Munu sabi hagiga?</br>Kulu: De Yesu,</br>Solo: Halleluya!</br>Kulu: De Yesu Yesu, Yesu abadiya.</br></br>Munu bi saidu nasi….</br>Munu bi raja tani…</br>Munu bi hibu nina…</br>Munu bi kalisu nasi…</br>
title: MUNU SABI HAGIGA

content: 1. Shufu gidaamu.(3x)</br>Yesua fii gidaamu.</br></br>2. Mata rija wara (3x)</br>Sheitani fii duluma.</br>
title: SHUF GIDAAM

content: Chorus</br> He’s coming down, down, down;</br> He’s coming down.</br> Yes the Lord of Lords is</br> coming down,</br> When the saints begin to pray,</br> The Lord will have His way,</br> And the glory of the Lord is</br> coming down.</br></br>1. Just now I feel the spirit coming down—</br>The spirit coming down </br>The spirit coming down</br>Just now I feel the spirit coming down – </br>The spirit coming down on me </br></br>2. Somebody touched me</br>Somebody touched me </br>Somebody touched my soul </br>When I was praying, praying to Jesus </br>Somebody touched my soul. </br>
title: HE’S COMING Down

content: ( S. Sundar Singh )</br>1. I have decided to follow Jesus(x3)</br>No turning back, no turning back.</br></br>2. The world behind me the cross</br>before me,(x3)</br>No turning back, no turning back.</br></br>3. Though no one joins me, still I will </br>follow,(X3)</br>No turning back, no turning back.</br></br>4. Will you decide now to follow Jesus? (x3)</br>No turning back, no turning back.</br></br>5. Sing glory glory; sing hallelujah, (x3)</br>No turning back, no turning back.</br>
title: I HAVE DECIDED

content: ( Isaac Watts)</br>1. Come, we that love the lord,</br>And let our joy be known;</br>Join in the song with sweet accord;</br>Join in the song with sweet accord;</br>And thus surround the throne,</br>And thus surround the throne,</br></br>Chorus</br>   We’re marching to Zion,</br>   Beautiful, beautiful Zion;</br>  We’re marching upward to Zion,</br>  The beautiful city of God.</br>  </br>2. Let those refuse to sing,</br>Who never knew our God;</br>But children of the Heavenly King,</br>But children of the Heavenly King,</br>May speak their joys abroad,</br>May speak their joys abroad,</br></br>3. The hills of Zion yields,</br>A thousand sacred sweets;</br>Before we reach the Heavenly fields,</br>Before we reach the Heavenly fields;</br>Or walk on the golden streets,</br>Or walk on the golden streets.</br></br>4. Then let our songs abound,</br>And every tears be dry;</br>We’re marching through Immanuel’s ground,</br>We’re marching through Immanuel’s ground,</br>To fairer worlds on high,</br>To fairer worlds on high.</br>
title: MARCHING TO ZION

content: 1. I want to walk with Jesus Christ,</br>All the days I live in this life on earth;</br>To give him complete control,</br>Of live and of soul.</br></br>Chorus</br>Follow Him, follow Him</br>Yield your life to Him</br>He has conquered death</br>He is King of Kings;</br>Accept the joy that he gives to </br>those,</br>Who yield their lives to Him.</br></br>2. I want to learn to speak to Him,</br>To pray to Him, confess my sin:</br>To open my life and let Him in,</br>For joy then be mine.</br></br>3. I want to learn to speak of Him,</br>My life must show that He lives in </br>me;</br>my deeds, my thoughts, my words </br>must speak</br>Of His love for me.</br>
title: I WANT TO WALK

content: ( William Cowper )</br>1. There is fountain filled with blood,</br>Drawn from Immanuel’s veins;</br>And sinners plunged beneath that</br>Flood,</br>Lose all their guilty stains;</br>Lose all their guilty stains,</br>Lose all their guilty stains.</br>And sinners plunged beneath that</br>Flood,</br>Lose all their guilty stains.</br></br>2. The dying thief rejoiced to see,</br>That fountain in his day;</br>And there may I, though vile as he,</br>Wash all my sin away;</br>Wash all my sin away;</br>Wash all my sin away;</br>And there may I, though vile as he,</br>Wash all my sin away;</br></br>3. Thou dying lamb! Thy precious</br>Blood</br>Shall never lose its power,</br>Till all the ransomed church of God</br>Are saved, to sin no more;</br>Are saved, to sin no more;</br>Are saved, to sin no more;</br>Till all the ransomed church of God</br>Are saved, to sin no more.</br></br>4. E’er since by faith I saw the stream</br>Thy flowing wounds supply,</br>Redeeming love has been my theme,</br>And shall be till I die;</br>And shall be till I die;</br>And shall be till I die;</br>Redeeming love has been my theme,</br>And shall be till I die.</br></br>5. There is nobler, sweeter song,</br>I’ll sing Thy power to save,</br>When this poor lisping, stammering </br>tongue,</br>Is ransomed from the grave;</br>Is ransomed from the grave,</br>Is ransomed from the grave;</br>When this poor lisping, stammering </br>tongue,</br>Is ransomed from the grave.</br>
title: THERE IS FOUNTAIN

content: ( Joseph M. Scriven )</br>1. What a friend we have in Jesus,</br>All our sins and griefs to bear,</br>What a privilege to carry.</br>Every thing to God in prayer!</br>O what peace we often forfeit,</br>O what needless pain we bear,</br>All because we do not carry,</br>Everything to God in prayer.</br></br>2. Have we trials and temptation?</br>Is there trouble any where?</br>We should never be discouraged;</br>Take it to the lord in prayer!</br>Can we find a friend so faithful</br>Who will all our sorrows share,</br>Jesus knows our every weakness;</br>Take it to the lord in prayer!</br></br>3. Are we weak and heavy laden,</br>Cumbered with a load of care?</br>Precious Saviour, still our refuge,</br>Take it to the lord in prayer!</br>Do thy friends despise, forsake thee?</br>Take it to the lord in prayer!</br>In His arms He’ll take and shield </br>thee,</br>Thou wilt find a solace there.</br>
title: WHAT A FRIEND

content: ( J. M. Black )</br>1. When the trumpet of the Lord shall </br>sound, and time shall be no more,</br>And the morning breaks, eternal,</br>bright and fair,</br>When the saved of earth shall gather </br>over on the other shore,</br>And the roll is called up yonder, I’ll</br>be there.</br></br>Chorus</br>When the roll is called up yonder,</br>When the roll is called up yonder,</br>When the roll is called up yonder,</br>When the roll is called up </br>yonder, I’ll be there.</br></br>2. On that bright and cloudless</br>morning, when the dead in Christ shall </br>rise,</br>And the glory of His resurrection </br>share;</br>When His chosen ones shall gather</br>to their home beyond the skies,</br>And the roll is called up yonder, I’ll</br>be there.</br></br>3. Let us labor for the master from the </br>dawn till setting sun,</br>Let us talk of all His wondrous love</br>and care,</br>Then, when all of life is over, and</br>our work on earth is done,</br>And the roll is called up yonder, I’ll</br>be there.</br>
title: WHEN THE ROLL IS CALLED

content: 1. Jesus, Jesus,</br>Jesus in the morning,</br>Jesus in the noon time,</br>Jesus, Jesus,</br>Jesus when the sun goes down.</br>No one can take away my sins,</br>No one can take away my sins,</br>No one can take away my sins,</br>Only the son of God.</br>Jesus did it, Jesus, Jesus took away </br>my sins,</br>Jesus, Jesus took away my sins.</br>Jesus, Jesus took away my sins.</br>Only the Son of God.</br></br>2. Walk with Him, walk with Him,</br>Walking in the morning,</br>Walking in the noon time,</br>Walk with Him, walk with Him,</br>Walking when the sun goes down.</br>No one can walk upon the water</br>No one can walk upon the water</br>No one can walk upon the water</br>Only the Son of God.</br>Jesus did it Jesus, Jesus walked</br>upon the water,</br>Jesus, Jesus walked upon the water,</br>Jesus, Jesus walked upon the water,</br>Only the Son of God.</br></br>3. Sabbath, Sabbath,</br>Sabbath in the morning,</br>Sabbath in the noon-time,</br>Sabbath, Sabbath,</br>Sabbath when the sun goes down.</br>No one can give me the Sabbath,</br>No one can give me the Sabbath,</br>No one can give me the Sabbath,</br>Only the Son of God.</br>Jesus did it, Jesus, Jesus the Lord </br>of Sabbath</br>Jesus, Jesus the Lord of Sabbath,</br>Jesus, Jesus the Lord of Sabbath,</br>Only the Son of God.</br>
title: JESUS IN THE MORNING

content: ( Fanny J. Crosby )</br>1. Don’t forget the Sabbath,</br>The Lord our God hath blessed,</br>Of all the week the brightest,</br>Of all the week the best;</br>It brings repose from labor,</br>It tells of joy divine,</br>Its beams of light descending,</br>With heavenly beauty shine.</br></br>Chorus</br>Welcome, welcome, ever welcome.</br>Blessed Sabbath day</br>Welcome, welcome, ever welcome</br>Blessed Sabbath day.</br></br>2. Keep the Sabbath holy,</br>And worship Him today,</br>Who said to His disciples,</br>“I am the living way;”</br>And if we meekly follow,</br>Our Saviour here below,</br>He’ll give us of the fountain,</br>Whose streams eternal flow.</br></br>3. Day of sacred pleasure!</br>Its golden hours we’ll spend,</br>In thankful hymns to Jesus,</br>The children’s dearest friend;</br>O gentle loving, Saviour,</br>How good and kind Thou art,</br>How precious is thy promise,</br>To dwell in every heart</br>
title: DON’T FORGET THE SABBATH

content: ( Jessie H. Brown )</br>1. Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go,</br>Anywhere He leads me in this world </br>below;</br>Anywhere without Him, dearest joys </br>would fade;</br>Anywhere with Jesus I am not </br>afraid.</br></br>Chorus</br>Anywhere! Anywhere! Fear I cannot</br>know;</br>Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go.</br></br>2. Anywhere with Jesus I am not alone;</br>Other friends may fail me, He is still</br>my own;</br>Though His hand may lead me over </br>dreary ways,</br>Anywhere with Jesus is a house of</br>praise.</br></br>3. Anywhere with Jesus I can go to</br>sleep,</br>When the gloomy shadows round</br>about me creep</br>Knowing I shall waken never more</br>to roam;</br>Anywhere with Jesus will be home</br>sweet home.</br>
title: ANYWHERE WITH JESUS

content: ( Fanny J. Crosby )</br>1. Blessed assurance, Jesus is mine!</br>O, what a foretaste of glory divine!</br>Heir of salvation, purchase of God,</br>Born of his Spirit, washed in His </br>blood.</br></br>Chorus</br>This is my story, this is my song,</br>Praising my Saviour all the day</br>long;</br>This is my story, this is my song,</br>Praising my Saviour all the day</br>long;</br></br>2. Perfect submission, perfect delight,</br>Visions of  rapture now burst on my </br>sight;</br>Angels descending bring from</br>above,</br>Echoes of mercy, whispers of love.</br></br>3. Perfect submission, all is at rest,</br>I in my Saviour am happy and blest;</br>Watching and waiting, looking</br>above,</br>Filled with his goodness, lost in His</br>love.</br>
title: BLESSED ASSURANCE

content: ( Daniel W. Whittle )</br>1. I know not why God’s wondrous grace</br>To me He hath made known;</br>Nor why, unworthy, Christ in love</br>Redeemed me for his own.</br></br>Chorus</br>But “I know whom I have believeth</br>And am persuaded that He is able</br>To keep that which I’ve committed</br>Unto Him against that day.”</br></br>2. I know not how this saving faith</br>To me he did impart;</br>Nor how believing in His word</br>Wrought peace within my heart.</br></br>3. I know not how the Spirit moves</br>Convincing men of sin;</br>Revealing Jesus through the word,</br>Creating faith in Him.</br></br>4. I know not when my lord may come,</br>At night or noon-day fair,</br>Nor if I walk the vale with Him</br>Or meet Him in the air.</br>
title: I KNOW NOT WHY

content: Chorus</br> Hallelujah anyhow,</br> I never let my trouble let me down,</br> Whatever problem life may bring.</br></br>1. Once you are I a valley dark and </br>low,</br>Your friends of truth and blue where</br>did they go?</br>If you want see that your troubles</br>fly,</br>Just sing this song and hold you </br>heart up high.</br></br>2. I can see the jail house dark and low,</br>But inside there are two preachers going</br>bold;</br>So they sang this song with their</br>Head up high.</br></br>3. I once read about a man named Job,</br>His trials and affliction laid him low,</br>His wife said “why don’t you curse</br>God and die?”</br>But he sang this song with his head </br>up high.</br>
title: HALLELUJAH ANYHOW

content: Chorus</br> Wrestling Jacob let me go,</br> Wrestling Jacob let me go,</br> Wrestling Jacob let me go,</br> I’ll never let you go.</br></br>1. Day is breaking Jacob let me go (3X)</br>I’ll never let you go.</br></br>2. When I am sinking down pity me. (3X)</br></br>3. If you’ll bless my soul I’ll let you go. (3x)</br>I’ll never let you go.</br>
title: WRESTLING JACOB

content: ( Eliza E. Hewitt )</br>1. Let us sing a song that will cheer us</br>by the way,</br>In a little while we’re going home;</br>For the night will end in the</br>everlasting day,</br>In a little while we’re going home</br></br>chorus</br>In the little while, in a little while,</br>We shall cross the billow’s foam;</br>We shall meet at last,</br>When the stormy winds are past,</br>In a little while we’re going home.</br></br>2. We will the work that our hands may find to do,</br>In a little while we’re going home </br>And the grace of God will our daily strength renew,</br>In a little while we’re going home </br></br>3. We will smooth the path for some</br>weary, way-worn feet,</br>In a little while we’re going home</br>And may loving hearts spread</br>around an influence sweet!</br>In a little while we’re going home</br></br>4. There‘s a rest beyond, there’s relief</br>from every care,</br>In a little while we’re going home</br>And no tear shall fall in the city</br>bright and fair,</br>In a little while we’re going home</br></br>
title: IN A LITTLE WHILE

content: ( Augustus M. Toplady )</br>1. Rock of ages, cleft for me,</br>Let me hide my self in Thee,</br>Let the water and blood;</br>From Thy riven side which flowed,</br>Be of sin the double cure,</br>Cleanse me from its guilt and power.</br></br>2. Not the labours of our hands,</br>Can fulfill Thy law’s demands,</br>Could my zeal no respite know;</br>Could my tears forever flow</br>All for sin could not atone,</br>Thou must save, and Thou alone.</br></br>3. When my pilgrimage I close;</br>Victor o’er the last of foes,</br>When I soar to worlds unknown;</br>And behold Thee on Thy throne,</br>Rock of ages, cleft for me,</br>Let my hide myself in Thee.</br>
title: ROCK OF AGE

content: ( Charles Wasley )</br>1. O for a thousand tongues to sing,</br>My great redeemer’s praise,</br>The glory of my God and king,</br>The triumphs of His grace!</br></br>2. My gracious Master and my God,</br>Assist me to proclaim,</br>To spread thro’ all the earth abroad,</br>The honour of Thy name.</br></br>3. Jesus! The name that charms our </br>fears,</br>That bids our sorrows cease;</br>‘Tis music in the sinners’ ears,</br>‘Tis life, and health, and peace.</br></br>4. He break the power of cancelled sin,</br>He set the prisoner free;</br>His blood can make the foulest clean</br>His blood availed for me.</br></br>5. He speaks, and listening to His </br>voice.</br>New life the dead receive;</br>The mournful, broken hearts rejoice,</br>The humble poor believe.</br></br>6. Hear Him, ye deaf; His praise, ye </br>dumb,</br>Your loosened tongues employ;</br>Ye blind, behold your saviour come;</br>And leap, ye lame, for joy.</br>
title: O FOR A THOUSAND TONGUES

content: ( Francis Ridley Harvergal )</br>1.  I gave My life for thee,</br>My precious blood I shed,</br>That thou might’st ransomed be,</br>And quickened from the dead;</br>I gave; I gave my life for thee,</br>What hast thou given for me?</br>I gave; I gave my life for Thee.</br>Hast tho left aught for Me?</br></br>2. My father’s house of light,</br>My glory-circled throne,</br>I left for earthly night,</br>For wanderings sad and lone;</br>I left; I left it all for thee,</br>Hast thou left aught for Me?</br>I left; I left it all for thee,</br>Hast thou left aught for Me?</br></br>3. I suffered much for thee,</br>More than thy tongue can tell,</br>Of bitterest agony,</br>To rescue thee from hell;</br>I’ve borne, I‘ve borne it all for thee,</br>What hast thou borne for Me?</br>I’ve borne, I‘ve borne it all for thee,</br>What hast thou borne for Me?</br>
title: I GAVE MY LIFE

content: ( Eliza E. Hewitt )</br>1. More about Jesus I would like to know,</br>More of his grace to others shows;</br>More of his saving fullness sees,</br>More of his love who died for me.</br></br>Chorus</br>More, more about Jesus,</br>More, more about Jesus;</br>More of his saving fullness sees,</br>More of his love who died for me.</br></br>2. More about Jesus let me learn,</br>More of His holy will discern;</br>Spirit of God, my teacher be,</br>Showing the things of Christ to me.</br></br>3. More about Jesus; in His Word,</br>Holding communion with my Lord,</br>Hearing His voices in every line,</br>Making each faithful saying mine.</br></br>4. More about Jesus. On His throne,</br>Riches in glory all His own;</br>More of his kingdom's sure increase,</br>More of His coming, Prince of peace.</br>
title: MORE ABOUT JESUS

content: (George Duffiel)</br>1. Stand up! Standup for Jesus!</br>Ye soldiers of cross’</br>Lift high His royal banner,</br>It must not suffer loss;</br>From victory unto victory,</br>His army shall He lead,</br>Till every foe is vanquished,</br>And Christ is Lord indeed.</br></br>2. Stand up! Stand up for Jesus!</br>The trumpet calls obey;</br>Forth to the mighty conflict,</br>In this His glorious day.</br>Ye that are His now serve Him</br>Against unnumbered foes;</br>Let courage rise with danger,</br>And strength to strength oppose.</br></br>3. Stand up! Stand up for Jesus!</br>Stand in His strength alone;</br>The arm of flesh will fail you;</br>Ye dare not trust your own.</br>Put on the gospel armour, </br>And, watching unto prayer,</br>Where duty calls, or danger,</br>Be never wanting there.</br></br>4. Stand up! Stand up for Jesus!</br>The strife will not be long </br>This day the noise of battle,</br>The next the victor’s song </br>To him that overcometh, </br>A crown of life shall be </br>He with the King of glory </br>Shall reign eternally</br>
title: STAND UP! STAND UP

content: (Cleland B. McAfee)</br>1. There is a place of quiet rest,</br>Near to the heart of God;</br>A place where sin cannot molest,</br>Near to the heart of God</br></br>Chorus</br>O Jesus, blest Redeemer,</br>Sent from heart of God,</br>Hold us, who wait before thee,</br>Near to the heart of God.</br></br>2. There is a place of comfort sweet,</br>Near to the heart of God,</br>A place where Saviour we meet our</br>Near to the heart of God.</br></br>3. There is a place of full release,</br>Near to the heart of God,</br>A place where all is joy and peace,</br>Near to the heart of God</br>
title: NEAR TO THE HEART

content: (Edward Mote)</br>1. My hope is built is nothing less,</br>Than Jesus’ blood and righteousness;</br>I dare not trust the sweetest frame,</br>But wholly lean on Jesus’ name</br></br>Chorus</br>On Christ, the solid rock, I stand,</br>All other ground is sinking sand,</br>All other ground is sinking sand,</br></br>2. When darkness seems to veil His face,</br>I rest on His unchanging grace;</br>In every high and stormy gale,</br>My anchor holds within the veil</br></br>3. His oath, His covenant, and blood,</br>Support me in the whelming flood;</br>When all around my soul gives way,</br>He then is all my hope and stay.</br></br>4. When He shall come with trumpet sound,</br>O may I then in Him be found;</br>Clad in His righteousness alone,</br>Faultless to stand before the throne</br>
title: MY HOPE IS BUILT

content: (Daniel W Whittle) </br>1. “There shall be showers of blessing”</br>This is the promise of love;</br>There shall be season of refreshing,</br>Sent from the Saviour above.</br></br>Chorus</br>Showers of blessing,</br>Showers of blessing we need;</br>Mercy drops round us are falling,</br>But for the showers we plead.</br></br>2. “There shall be showers of blessing”</br>Precious reviving again;</br>Over the hills and the valleys,</br>Sound of abundances of rain.</br></br>3. “There shall be showers of blessing”</br>Send them upon us, O Lord;</br>Grant to us now a refreshing,</br>Come, and now honour thy word.</br></br>4. “There shall be showers of blessing”</br> O that today they might fall;</br>Now as to God we’re confessing,</br>Now as on Jesus we call!</br>
title: SHOWERS OF BLESING

content: Ps.23                     (Scottish psalter, 1650)</br>1. The Lord’s my shepherd; I’ll not want.</br>He makes me down to lie</br>In pastures green; He leadeth me</br>The quiet waters by.</br>He leadeth me,He leadeth me</br>The quiet waters by.</br></br>2. My soul he doth restore again,</br>And me to work doth make</br>Within the path of righteousness,</br>E’en for His own name’s sake;</br>Within the path of righteousness,</br>E’en for His own name’s sake.</br></br>3. Yea, though I walk though death’s</br>dark vale,</br>Yet will I fear no ill;</br>For thou art with me, and thy rod</br>And staff me comfort still.</br>For thou art with me, and thy rod</br>And staff me comfort still.</br></br>4. My table thou hast furnished</br>In presence of my foes;</br>My head Thou dost with oil anoint,</br>And my cup overflows</br>My head Thou dost with oil anoint,</br>And my cup overflows</br></br>5. Goodness and mercy all my life</br>Shall surely follow me,</br>And in God’s house forevermore</br>My dwelling-place shall be.</br>And in God’s house forevermore</br>My dwelling-place shall be.</br>
title: THE LORD’S MY SHEPHERD

content: ( George Bennard)</br>1. On a hill far away stood an old </br>rugged cross,</br>The emblem of suffering and shame;</br>And I love that old cross where the</br>dearest and best</br>For a world of lost sinners was slain.</br></br>Chorus</br>So I’ll cherish the old rugged cross,</br>Till my trophies at last I lay down;</br>I will cling to the old rugged cross,</br>And exchange it some day for a crown.</br></br>2. Oh, that old rugged cross, so</br>despised by the world,</br>Has a wondrous attraction for me;</br>For the dear lamb of God left His</br>glory above,</br>To bear it to dark Calvary.</br></br>3. To the old rugged cross I will ever </br>be true,</br>Its shame and approach gladly bear;</br>Then he will call me some day to my</br>home far away,</br>Where His glory  forever I’ll share.</br>
title: ON A HILL FAR AWAY

content: (Jeremaiah Eames Rankin)</br>1. Are you weary, are you heavy-</br>hearted?</br>Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus;</br>Are you grieving over joys departed?</br>Tell it to Jesus alone.</br></br>Chorus</br>Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus</br>He is a friend that’s well known:</br>You've no other such a friend or brother</br>Tell it to Jesus alone.</br></br>2. Do the tears flows down your cheek unbidden?</br>Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus</br>Have you sins that from the world are hidden?</br>Tell it to Jesus alone.</br></br>3. Do you fear the gathering clouds of sorrow</br>Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus</br>Are you anxious what shall come tomorrow?</br>Tell it to Jesus alone.</br></br>4. Are you troubled at tho’t of dying?</br>Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus</br>For Christ’s coming Kingdom are you sighing?</br>Tell it to Jesus alone.</br>
title: TELL IT TO JESUS

content: (Karen Laferty)</br>1. Seek ye first the kingdom of God</br>And his righteousness,</br>And all the things shall be added</br>unto you-Allelu,Alleuia.</br></br>2. Ask, and it shall be given unto you,</br>Seek, and ye shall find;</br>Knock and the door shall be opened</br>Unto you – Alellu, Alleluia </br></br>3. Man does not live by bread alone,</br>But by every word</br>That proceeds from the mouth of the </br>Lord-Allelu, Alleluia</br>
title: SEEK YE FIRST

content: (Unknown)</br>1. Side by side we stand, awaiting God’s command,</br>Worshipping the saving King;</br>Living by His grace and moving on faith,</br>Jesus Himself will see us through.</br></br>Chorus</br>Meet me in heaven, we’ll join hands together;</br>Meet me by the savior’s side,</br>I will meet you in heaven; we’ll sing songs together;</br>Brothers and sisters, I’ll be there!-</br>pray that we all be there!</br>(End of last chorus only)</br></br>2. Soldiers all are we, to go where Jesus leads,</br>To fight the foe and we will overcome;</br>Heaven is our gold, to save every soul,</br>Pray that we all will be there.</br>
title: SIDE BY SIDE

content: (Thomas O. Chisolm)</br>1. Great is thy faithfulness, God my</br>Father,</br>There is no shadow of turning with </br>Thee;</br>Thou changes not, thy</br>Compassions, they fail not,</br>As thou hast been thou forever wilt </br>be.</br></br>Chorus</br>Great is thy faithfulness! Great is</br>Thy faithful!</br>Morning by Morning new mercies I </br>see.</br>All have needed Thy hand hath provided,</br>Great is Thy faithfulness! Lord unto me!</br></br>2. Summer and winter and spring time and harvest,</br>Sun , moon and stars in their course above;</br>Join with all nature in manifold witness,</br>To Thy great faithfulness, mercy and love.</br></br>3. Pardon for sin and a peace endureth,</br>Thy own dear presence to cheer and to guide;</br>Strength for today and bright hope for tomorrow,</br>Blessing all mine, with ten thousand beside.</br>
title: GREAT IS THY FAITHFULNESS

content: (Fanny J. Crosby)</br>1. Redeemed! How I love to proclaim</br>It!</br>Redeemed by the blood of the </br>Lamb;</br>Redeemed through his infinite</br>Mercy,</br>His child, and forever, I am.</br></br>Chorus</br>Redeemed, Redeemed,</br>Redeemed by the blood of the</br>Lamb</br>Redeemed, Redeemed,</br>His child, and forever, I am.</br></br>2. Redeemed! And so happy in Jesus!</br>No language my rapture can tell;</br>I know that the light of his presence. </br>With me doth continually dwell.</br></br>3. I know there is crown that is waiting,</br>In yonder bright mansion for me;</br>And soon with the saints made perfect,</br>At home with the lord I shall be.</br>
title: REDEEMED!

content: Chorus</br>Go tell it on the mountain, </br>Over the hills and everywhere:</br>Go, tell on the mountain,</br>That Jesus Christ is born!</br></br>1. While the shepherds kept their watching,</br>Over silent flocks by night,</br>Behold throughout the heavens,</br>There shone a holy light.</br></br>2. The shepherds feared and trembled,</br>When lo! Above the earth;</br>Rang out the angel chorus,</br>That hailed our Saviour’s birth.</br></br>3. Down in a lowly manger,</br>The humble Christ was born;</br>And brought us God’s salvation,</br>That blessed Christmas morn.</br>
title: GO TELL IT ON THE MOUNTAIN

content: 1. How far from home? I asked, on</br>I bent my steps-the watchman </br>Spake:</br>“The long, dark night is almost gone,</br>The morning soon will break.</br>Then weep no more, but speed thy </br>flight,</br>With hope's bright star thy guiding </br>ray,</br>Till thou shalt reach the realms of</br>light,</br>In everlasting day.”</br></br>2. I asked the warrior on the field;</br>This was his soul inspiring song:</br>“With courage, bold, the sword I’ll</br>Wield.</br>The battle is not long.</br>Then weep no more, but well endure,</br>The conflict till thy work is done;</br>For this we know, the prize is sure,</br>When the victory is won”</br></br>3. I asked again; earth, Sea, and sun </br>Seemed, with one voice, to make reply:</br>“Time’s wasting sands are nearly</br>Run, Eternity is nigh.</br>Then weep no more- warning tones,</br>Portentous signs are thickening round,</br>The whole creation, waiting, groans,</br>To hear the trumpet sound.”</br></br>4. Not far from home! Oh blessed thought!</br>The traveler’s lonely heart to cheer;</br>Which oft a healing balm has brought,</br>And dried the mourner’s tear.</br>Then weep no more, since we shall meet</br>Where weary footsteps never roam..</br>Our trials past, our joys complete,</br>Safe in our Father’s home.</br></br>                (Annie R. Smith)
title: HOW FAR FROM HOME?

content: 1. When we walk with the Lord </br>In light of His word, </br>What a glory He Sheds on our way!</br>While we do His good will,</br>He abides with us still,</br>And with all who will trust and obey.</br></br>Chorus</br>Trust and obey, for there’s no other way</br>To be happy in Jesus, but to trust and obey.</br></br>2. Not a shadow can rise,</br>Not a cloud in the skies,</br>But Hs smile quickly drives it away;</br>Not a doubt nor fear,</br>Not a sigh nor a tear</br>Can abide while we trust and obey</br></br>3. Not a burden we bear,</br>Not a sorrow we share,</br>But our toil He doth richly repay;</br>Not a grief nor a loss,</br>Not a frown nor a cross,</br>But is blest if we trust and obey.</br></br>4. But we never can prove,</br>The delights of His love,</br>Until all on the altar we lay,</br>For the favor He shows </br>And the joys He bestows,</br>Are for them who will trust </br>And obey.</br></br>5. Then in the fellowship sweet,</br>We will sit has feet,</br>Or we’ll walk by his side in the way;</br>What He says we will do,</br>Where He sends we will go,</br>Never fear, only trust and obey</br></br>                 (Composed by J.H. Sammis)</br>
title: TRUST AND OBEY

content: 1. It’s not an easy road we are travelling to heaven,</br>For many are the thorns on the way;</br>It’s not an easy road but Saviour is with us,</br>His presence gives us joy every day.</br></br>Chorus</br>No, no, no……</br>No, no it’s not an easy road,</br>No, no it’s not an easy road,</br>But Jesus walks besides me and</br>Brightens the journeys,</br>And lightens every heavy load</br></br>2. It's not an easy road, there are trials</br>And troubles,</br>And many are the dangers we meet.</br>But Jesus guards and keeps us so</br>That nothing can harm us and smoothen  </br>the rugged paths for our feet</br></br>3. Though I am often footsore and weary from travel,</br>Though I am often bowed down </br>With care,</br>A better day is coming when home is</br>In glory</br>I’ll rest in perfect peace over there.</br></br>    (Composed by John W. Peterson)
title: IT’S NOT AN EASY ROAD

content: 1. Amazing Grace how sweet the sound,</br>That saved a wretch like me!</br>I once was lost, but now I am found,</br>Was blind, but now I see.</br></br>2. T was grace that taught my heart to fear,</br>And grace my fears relieved;</br>How precious did that grace appear,</br>The hour I first believed.</br></br>3. Through many dangers, toils and snares,</br>I have already come;</br>‘Tis grace hath brought me safe thus far,</br>And grace will lead me home.</br></br>4. When we've been there ten thousand years,</br>Bright shining as the sun;</br>We’ve no less days to sing</br>Praise,</br>Than when we’ve first begun.</br></br>          (Composed by John Newton)</br>
title: AMAZING GRACE.

content: (Cece Winans)</br>1. All to Jesus I surrender,</br>All to Him I freely give;</br>I will ever love and trust Him,</br>In His presence daily lives</br></br>Chorus</br>I surrender all,</br>I surrender all,</br>All to Thee, my blessed Saviour,</br>I surrender all.</br></br>2. All to Jesus I surrender,</br>Humbly at his feet I bow;</br>Worldly pleasures all forsaken,</br>Take me, Jesus, takes now.</br></br>3. All to Jesus I surrender, wholly </br>Make me Saviour, wholly Thine;</br>Let me feel Holy Spirit,</br>Truly know that Thou art mine.</br></br>4. All to Jesus I surrender,</br>Now I feel the sacred flame</br>O the joy of full salvation!</br>Glory, glory to His name!</br>
title: I SURRENDER ALL

content: ( Robert Robinson)</br>1. Come, thou Fount of blessing,</br>Tune my heart to sing Thy grace,</br>Streams of mercy, never ceasing,</br>Call for songs of loudest praise;</br>Teach me ever to adore Thee,</br>May I still Thy goodness proves,</br>While the hope of endless glory,</br>Fill my heart with joy and love.</br></br>2. Here I raise my Ebenezer,</br>Hither by thy help I’ve come,</br>And I hope by Thy good pleasure,</br>Safely to arrive at home;</br>Jesus sought me when a stranger,</br>Wandering from the fold of God,</br>He to rescue me from danger,</br>Interposed His precious blood.</br></br>3. O, to grace how great a debtor!</br>Daily I’m constrained to be!</br>Let thy goodness, like fetter,</br>Bind me closer still to Thee;</br>Prone to wander, Lord, I feel it,</br>Prone to leave the God I love,</br>Here’s my heart-O, take and seal it,</br>Seal it for thy courts above</br>
title: COME, THOU FOUNT

content: 1. You are satisfied by the things of this world,</br>You have many things like silver and </br>Gold,</br> The beautiful city prepared by Jesus,</br>It’s sight much greater than earthly</br>Gold. (x2)</br></br>Chorus</br>It’s righteous city,</br>City far as the mountain,</br>Mountain the beautiful city,</br>Prepared for us, with no more </br>Tears,</br>With no more sorrows,</br>O, let’s rejoicing Praising the</br>    Lord. (x2)</br></br>2. You said you’re poor; you’re the son </br>Of Jesus,</br>But Jesus suffered, was crucified for</br>us to be save from the sin</br>of this world,</br>The beautiful city, prepared for us, (x2)</br></br>3. Though we are tempted by the things of this world,</br>We have our ambassador, Jesus is our strength;</br>Soon we are leaving this temptation</br>World,</br>So that we make an eternal life. (x2)</br>
title: YOU SAID YOU ARE NOT SATISFIED

content: 1. Where two or three are gathered in </br>my name.(x2)</br></br>There am I, there am I,</br>Where two or three are gathered in </br>my name,</br>There I am in their midst ever </br>more. (x2)</br></br>2. We gather now, O, Lord in your </br>name. (x2)</br></br>In Your love, in your love,</br>We gather now O Lord in your </br>name</br>You are here, You are ever </br>more.(x2)</br></br>3. We ask you, Lord to show us the</br>Way,(x2)</br></br>To be yours, to be yours,</br>We ask you, Lord to show us the</br>way more .(x2)</br>to be yours, to be yours ever more.(2x)</br>
title: WHERE TWO OR THREE

content: 1. O brother, once I was a sinner in </br>charge of joy,</br>peace and happiness of this world,</br>I tried all things the world could </br>offer,</br>But all in vain until Jesus came in </br>my heart.(x2)</br></br>Chorus</br>O, Jesus, Jesus I love you greatly</br>take me, take me home;</br>Oh Jesus, Jesus the rock of ages</br>Saviour, hallelujah! (x2)</br></br>2. No matter what you are oh what you </br>do come to Jesus,</br>He will give you rest, He will take</br>away you burden;</br>And give you joy, peace and</br>happiness that you seek.(x2)</br>
title: O BROTHER ONCE I WAS A SINNER

content: 1. Let not your heart be in troubled,</br>Believe in Jesus the king, (x2)</br></br>Chorus </br>Solo: Jesus is coming</br>Bass: Jesus is coming again</br>Solo: for those who trust Him</br>Bass: for those who trust Him</br>All: we shall rule with the Lord</br>forever and ever.(x2)</br></br>2. The pure in heart (x2)</br>Believe in Jesus the King. (x2)</br></br>3. Take the world but give me Jesus</br>My king my Saviour shall be.(x2)</br></br>Chorus</br>Solo: Mm…mm…</br>Bass: En lalarwa. (x2)</br>Lalarwa Yesu (The pure in heart)</br>
title: LET NOT YOUR HEART

content: (Isaac Watts)</br>1.  Joy to the world the lord will come,</br>Let earth receive her King;</br>Let every heart prepare, Him room,</br>And heaven and nature sing,</br>And heaven and nature sing,</br>And heaven, and heaven, and nature </br>sing.</br></br>2. Joy to earth the Lord will reign,</br>Let men their songs employ;</br>While field and flood, rock hills and</br>plains,</br>Repeat the sounding joy,</br>Repeat the sounding joy,</br>Repeat, repeat, repeat the sounding </br>joy</br></br>3. No more let sin and sorrow grow,</br>No thorn infests the ground;</br>He comes to make His blessing flow,</br>Far as the curse is found,</br>Far as the curse is found,</br>Far as, far as the curse is found.</br></br>4. Soon will he rule the earth with,</br>grace,</br>And make the nation prove,</br>The glories of His righteousness,</br>And wonders of His love,</br>And wonders of His love,</br>And wonders, and wonders of His </br>love.</br>
title: JOY TO THE WORLD

content: ( Ralph E. Hudson)</br>1. Blessed the name, blessed be the</br>name.</br>Blessed be the name of the Lord. </br>(x2)</br></br>Chorus</br>O, hallelujah, hallelujah</br>Blessed be the name of the Lord. (x2)</br></br>2. Jesus is the name, Jesus is the name.</br>Jesus is the name of the Lord. (x2)</br></br>Chorus</br>O, hallelujah, hallelujah</br>Jesus is the name of the Lord. (x2)</br></br>3. Worthy to be praised, worthy to be </br>praise.</br>Worthy to be praise, is the Lord.(x2)</br></br>Chorus</br>O, hallelujah, hallelujah</br>Worth to be praise is the Lord.</br>(x2)</br></br>
title: BLESSED BE THE NAME

content: (John M. Moore)</br>1. Days are filled with sorrow and care,</br>Hearts are lonely and drear;</br>Burdens are lifted at Calvary,</br>Jesus is very near.</br></br>Chorus</br>Burdens are lifted at Calvary,</br>Calvary, Calvary</br>Burdens are lifted at Calvary,</br>Jesus is very near.</br></br>2. Cast your care on Jesus today,</br>Leave your worry and care;</br>Burdens are lifted at Calvary,</br>Jesus is very near.</br></br>3. Troubled soul the saviour can see,</br>Every heartache and tear;</br>Burdens are lifted at Calvary,</br>Jesus is very near.</br>
title: BURDENS ARE LIFTED

content: (Isaac Watts)</br>1. Lord in the morning Thou shalt hear,</br>My voice ascending high;</br>To Thee will I direct my prayer,</br>To Thee lift up mine eye-</br></br>2. Up to the hills where Christ is gone,</br>To plead for all His saints;</br>Presenting at His father’s throne,</br>Our songs and our complaints.</br></br>3. Oh may thy spirit guide my feet,</br>In ways of righteousness;</br>Make every path of duty straight;</br>And plain my face.</br></br>4. The men that love and fear Thy name,</br>Shall see their hopes fulfilled;</br>The almighty God will compass them,</br>With favour as a shield.</br>
title: LORD IN THE MORNING

content: ( Mrs.M.A . Kiddler)</br>1. Lord I care not for riches,</br>Neither silver nor gold,</br>I would make sure of heaven; I </br>would enter the fold;</br>In the book of Thy Kingdom with its </br>pages so fair,</br>Tell me Jesus, my saviour, is my </br>name written there?</br></br>Chorus</br>Is my name written there, on the</br>page white and fair,</br>In the book of Thy Kingdom, is my </br>name written there?</br></br>2. Lord, my sins they are many, like the</br>sands of the sea,</br>But thy blood, O my Saviour, is </br>sufficient for me; </br>For thy promise is written in bright </br>letter that glow,</br>“though your sins be as scarlet, I</br>Will make them like snow.”</br></br>3. O that beautiful city with its mansion of light,</br>With its glorified beings in pure </br>garments of white;</br>Where no evil thing cometh to </br> despoil what is fair,</br>Where the angels are watching,</br>Is my name written there?</br>
title: IS MY NAME WRITTEN

content: 1. I was a sinner rejected in sin,</br>But Jesus came for me;</br>He looked for me there and found</br>me waiting,</br>Shook my hand and took me home.</br></br>Chorus</br>O, let me march in,</br>March there in pairs</br>March and meet the Lord,</br>The lord is waiting there in </br>heaven,</br>waiting for you and for me.</br></br>2. O there is darkness, among the </br>Sinners</br>My hope for life was gone;</br>The devil ruled me and gave me </br>orders,</br>Go and do what I have said”</br></br>3. My life was all gone, my heart was</br>yearning,</br>It was a cry for peace,</br>But Jesus came in and died for</br>Sinners,</br>He died to redeem sinners.</br></br>4. (Humming and reading)</br>The lord is coming,</br>Repent you sinners and join us;</br>And wait for Jesus that we may go</br>And join the saints.</br>
title: I WAS A SINNER

content: 1. The man named Jonah, was</br>Counseled by the Lord</br>To go and preach immediately but</br>disobeyed. (x2)</br></br>Chorus </br>I will never be like Jonah</br>I will never be like Jonah</br>Who received the word of God but </br>disobeyed. (x2)</br></br>2. On his way to tarsus, he cause the </br>sea to storm, </br>and he was thrown in the water and    </br>swallowed by the fish.(x2)</br></br>3. Some people like Jonah, they refused </br>the words of God,</br>instead of going forward they turn </br>backward.(x2)</br>
title: THE MAN NAMED JONAH

content: (John H McNaughson)</br>1. There is beauty all round,</br>When there’s love at home;</br>There is joy in every sound,</br>When there is love at home.</br>peace and plenty here abide</br>Smiling fair on every side;</br>Time doth softly, sweetly glide,</br>When there is love at home.</br></br>Chorus</br>Love at home, love at home</br>Time doth softly, sweetly glide,</br>When there is love at home.</br></br>2. Kindly heaven smile above,</br>When there is love at home.</br>All the earth is fill’d with love,</br>When there is love at home.</br>Sweeter sings the Brooklet by,</br>Brighter beams azure the sky;</br>O, there’s one who smiles on high,</br>When there is love at home.</br></br>3. Jesus, make me wholly thine,</br>Then there's love at home;</br>May thy sacrifice be  mine.</br>Then there’s love at home.</br>Safely from all harm I’ll rest,</br>With no sinful care distress’d;</br>Thro’ thy tender mercy blessed,</br>When there’s love at home.</br>
title: LOVE AT HOME

content: (Mrs. A.S . Bridgewater)</br>1. We read of a place called heaven,</br>Its made for the pure and the free;</br>These truths in God’s word He has given,</br>How beautiful heaven must be.</br></br>Chorus</br>How beautiful heaven must be</br>(must be)</br>Sweet home of the happy and free;</br>Fair heaven of rest for the weary,</br>How beautiful heaven must be.</br></br>2. In heaven no drooping nor pining</br>No wishing for elsewhere to be;</br>God’s light is forever shining,</br>How beautiful heaven must be.</br></br>3. Pure waters of life they are flowing,</br>And all who will drink may be free;</br>Rare jewels of splendor are glowing,</br>How beautiful heaven must be.</br></br>4. The angels so sweetly are singing,</br>Up there by the beautify sea;</br>Sweet cords from their gold harps are ringing,</br>How beautiful heaven must be.</br>
title: HOW BEAUTIFUL

content: 1. O when the saints go marching in,</br>O when the saints go marching in,</br>O Lord, I want to be among that</br>Number,</br>When the saints go marching in,</br></br>2. O when they crown Him Lord of all,</br>O when they crown Him Lord of all;</br>O Lord, I want to be among that number.</br>when they crown him Lord of all.</br></br>3. O, when all knees bow at his name, </br>O, when all knees bow at his name, </br>O Lord, i want to be among that number,</br>when all knees bow at his name.</br></br>4. O, when they sing the saviour's praise,</br>O, when they sing the saviour's praise,</br>O, Lord i want to be among that number,</br>when they sing the saviour's praise. </br></br>5. O when the saints go marching in,</br>O when the saints go marching in,</br>O Lord, I want to be among that</br>Number,</br>When the saints go marching in,</br>
title: O, WHEN THE SAINTS

content: 1. Whisper a prayer in the morning,</br>Whisper a prayer at noon;</br>Whisper a prayer in the evening,</br>To keep your heart in tune.</br></br>2. God answers prayer in the morning,</br>Good answers prayer at noon;</br>God answer prayer in the evening</br>So keep your heart in tune.</br></br>3. Jesus may come in the morning</br>Jesus may come at noon;</br>Jesus may come in the evening,</br>So keep your heart in tune.</br>
title: WHISPER A PRAYER

content: Chorus</br> It was a grand day when I was born again.</br> It was a grand day when I was born again</br> It was a grand day when I was born  again</br> It was a grand day when I was born again</br></br></br>1. Some things I used to do, I do the no more;(3x)</br>It was a grand day when I was born again.</br></br>2. Some books I used to read..</br>Some songs I used to sing…</br>
title: IT WAS A GRAND  DAY

content: (Wayne Hooper)</br>1. We have this hope that burns within our hearts.</br>Hope in the coming of the Lord.</br>We have this faith that Christ alone imparts,</br>Faith in the promise of His Word.</br>We believe the time is here when the nations far and near;</br>Shall awake and shout and sing,</br>Halleluya! Christ is King!</br>We have this hope that burns within our hearts,</br>Hope in the coming of the Lord.</br>We are united in Jesus Christ our Lord.</br></br>2. We are united in His love.</br>Love for the waiting people of the world,</br>People who need our Saviour’s love.</br>Soon the heav’ns will open wide,</br>Christ will come to claim His bride,</br>All the universe will sing hallelujah! Christ is King!</br>We have this hope, this faith, and God’s great love,</br>We are united in Christ.</br>
title: WE HAVE THIS HOPE

content: 1. Sweet Sabbath School, more dear to me</br>Than fairest place dome,</br>My heart ever turns with joy to thee,</br>My own dear Sabbath home. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Sabbath home! Sweet home,</br>Blessed home! Sweet home, (2x)</br>My heart ever turns with joy to thee,</br>My own dear Sabbath home.</br></br>2. Here first my willful, wandering heart,</br>The way to life was shown;</br>Here first, I stood the better part </br>And gained a Sabbath home. (2x)</br></br>3. Here, Jesus stood with loving voice,</br>In treating me to come;</br>And make of Him, my only choice,</br>In this dear Sabbath home. (2x)</br></br>
title: SWEET SABBATH SCHOOL

content: 1. I’ve got a home in glory land that out shines the sun (3x)</br>Way beyond the blue.</br></br>Chorus</br>Do Lord, O do Lord, O do remember me. (3x)</br>Way beyond the blue</br></br>2. I took Jesus as my Savior---you take Him too, (3x)</br>Way beyond the blue.</br></br>3. If you cannot bear the cross you can’t wear the crown, (3x)</br>Way beyond the blue.</br>
title: I’VE GOT A HOME

content: Chorus</br> We give you praise…</br> Lord, we give you praise.</br> How majestic is your name!</br> Lord, we give you praise. (2x)</br></br>1. You created all things by Your hands,</br>Lord, we give You praise;</br>The earth the sun, the stars and the moon,</br>Lord, we give you praise.</br></br>2. Angels above to worship Your Name,</br>Lord, we give You praise;</br>Down here on earth we worship</br>Your name,</br>Lord, we give you praise.</br></br>3. Your mighty throne forever endures, </br>Lord, we give You praise;</br>Forever, Lord, and ever, Amen.</br>Lord, we give You praise.</br></br>4. Glory and praise and honour be yours,</br>Lord, we give you praise;</br>Forever Lord, and ever, amen.</br>Lord, we give You praise.</br>
title: WE GIVE YOU PRAISE

content: 1. When He calls me, I will answer (3x)</br>I ‘ll be somewhere listening for my name.</br></br>Chorus</br>I’ll be somewhere listening (2x)</br>I’ll be somewhere listening for my name (2x)</br></br>2. When He calls you, you will answer (3x)</br>You’ll be somewhere listening for your name;</br>(You’ll be somewhere listening for your name) 2x</br></br>3.When He sends us, will we trust and go? (3x)</br>We’ll be somewhere listening for His word.</br>(we’ll be somewhere listening for His word) (2x)</br>
title: WHEN HE CALLS ME

content: Chorus</br> A joyful song (3x)</br> We sing to you, Lord.</br></br>1. Another day is dawning,</br>Dear master let it be;</br>In working or in waiting,</br>Another day for you.</br></br>2. Another day of mercy,</br>Of faith and of grace,</br>Another day of gladness,</br>In the shining of Your face.</br></br>3. Another day of progress,</br>Another day of praise,</br>Another day of proving,</br>Your presence every hour.</br></br>4.Another day of service,</br>Of witness to Your love;</br>Another day of training.</br>For holier work above.</br>
title: A JOYFUL SONG

content: 1. Seeking the lost—yes kindly entreating.</br>Wanderers on the mountain astray;</br>“Come unto Me” His message repeating,</br>Words of the Master speaking today.</br></br>Chorus</br>(Bass leads, the rest follow)</br>Going afar upon the mountain,</br>Bringing the wand’rer back again,</br>Into the fold of my Redeemer,</br>Jesus, the Lamb for sinners slain.</br></br>2. Seeking the lost—and pointing to Jesus</br>Souls that are weak and hearts that are sore,</br>Leading them forth in ways of salvation,</br>Showing the path of life evermore.</br></br>3. Thus I would go on missions of mercy,</br>Following Christ from day unto day,</br>Cheering the faint and raising the fallen,</br>Pointing the lost to Jesus, the Way.</br></br>  (Composed by William A. Ogden)</br>
title: SEEKING THE LOST

content: Chorus</br> He is real, Jesus is real,</br> He is real to my soul;</br> He is real, this I know,</br> And I live to know He is real. (2x)</br></br>Solo:</br>1. In the days gone past and by</br>When I didn’t know the love of Christ</br>When I didn’t know I will be free,</br>Jesus came and save my soul</br></br>2. When my brothers had all gone,</br>When I thought I had no friend;</br>When my beloved ones had left me,</br>Jesus came and proved a friend.</br></br>3. When my sisters had all gone,</br>When I thought I had no friend;</br>When my beloved ones had left me,</br>Jesus came and proved a friend.</br>
title: HE IS REAL JESUS IS REAL

content: 1. For God so love the world,</br>Through Jesus Christ the Son;</br>Was shown on Calvary,</br>So let us sing about love. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Love, love is the greater thing,</br>Love, love is the only thing</br>Love, love is the greater thing,</br>So let us sing about love. (2x)</br></br>2. When I had gone so deep,</br>In life of misery;</br>He came and died for me,</br>So let us sing about love. (2x)</br>
title: FOR GOD SO LOVED

content: </br>Chorus</br> Telephone to glory, oh, what joy divine,</br> I can feel the current moving on the line,</br> Built by God the Father for His loved and own,</br> We may talk to Jesus through this royal telephone.</br></br>1. Central’s never “busy, always on the line;</br>You may hear from heaven almost any time;</br>Tis a royal services, free for one and all;</br>When you get in trouble, give this royal line a call.</br></br>2. There will be no charges telephone is free.</br>It was built for service, just for you and me;</br>There will be no waiting on this royal line,</br>Telephone to glory always answers just in time.</br></br>3. Fail to get the answer, Satan’s crossed your wire,</br>By some strong delusion, or some base desire,</br>Take away obstructions, God is on the throne,</br>And you’ll get your answer through this royal telephone.</br></br>4. If your line is “grounded,” and connection true</br>Has been lost with Jesus, tell you what to do;</br>Prayer and faith and promise mend the broken wire;</br>Till your soul is burning with the Pentecostal fire.</br></br>5. Carnal combinations cannot get control</br>Of this line to glory, anchored in the soul;</br>Storm and trial cannot disconnect the line,</br>Held in constant keeping by the Father’s hand divine.</br></br>(Composed by Frederick M. Lehman)
title: TELEPHONE TO GLORY

content: 1. Love not the world and all the things in it.</br>For Satan placed them all,</br>To close our way to heaven,</br></br>Chorus</br>Praise the Lord brothers</br>Praise the Lord sisters;</br>Praise the true God.</br>The Judgment hour is come.</br></br>2. Worship not the sun and all the stars above,</br>For God created them all;</br>To give the light they have,</br></br>3. Obey not a man and all the laws he gives,</br>Praise only God alone;</br>Who created heaven and earth,</br></br>4. The Lord is coming soon to take His people home,</br>And leave the wicked  below;</br>To suffer eternal death.</br></br>Chrous</br>Don’t delay brothers</br>Don’t delay sisters;</br>Don’t delay now,</br>The time of judgment is come</br>
title: LOVE NOT THE WORLD

content: Chorus</br> How can I repay the Lord, for all His gifts?</br> For all His gifts to me I will take, </br> I will take in my hands the cup of salvation forever.</br></br>1. I bring to you, Lord, my thanks offering.</br>I nearly fell but the Lord has held me.</br></br>2. You died for me when I was still a sinner.</br>Oh Jesus loving Lord my Sovereign King.</br>
title: HOW CAN I REPAY THE LORD?

content: 1. Pilgrims united in Christ to our home, Firm ahead we stride,</br>Christ is the way that will lead to our God,</br>Now our hope range high.</br></br>Chorus</br>Long ago we walked in darkness,</br>Now we have the light,</br>Yes with faith we search in brightness,</br>Faith in Jesus Christ.</br></br>2. Christ is the truth and the role of our thought,</br>As we strive for peace;</br>Mind then and heart we belong to the Lord,</br>Truth shall make us free.</br></br>3. Christ is our light the horizons is bright,</br>All are glow right now,</br>Walk with the cross in pursuit of the bright,</br>Christ has shown us now.</br></br>4. Love for our neighbour we can as the law,</br>As the Lord demands;</br>Life is the price He has paid for our cause,</br>All our hearts demands</br></br>5. God is our goal and the end of all ends,</br>Seen on Calvary’s cross;</br>Christ then declared by His raising from the dead,</br>God shall reign in all.</br></br>6. Pilgrims rejoice for your feet are assured.</br>Christ has cleared the paths;</br>Walk then in Him and your heart is assured</br>Of the bliss that lasts.</br>
title: PILGRIMS UNITED

content: 1. Face to face with Christ my Saviour,</br>Face to face, what will it be;</br>When with rapture I behold Him,</br>Jesus Christ, who died for me?</br></br>Chorus</br>  Face to face shall I behold Him,</br>  Far beyond the starry sky.</br>  Face to face in all His glory</br>  I shall see Him by and by!</br></br>2. Only faintly now I see Him,</br>With the darkening veil between;</br>When His glory shall be seen.</br></br>3. What rejoicing His presence,</br>When are banished grief and pain;</br>When the crooked ways are strengthened,</br>And the dark things shall be pain!</br></br>4.  Face to face oh, blissful moment!</br> Face to face –to see and know;</br> Face to face with my Redeemer,</br> Jesus Christ, who loves me so.</br></br> (Composed by Mr. Frank A.)
title: FACE TO FACE

content: 1. Hover o’er me Holy Spirit,</br>Bathe my trembling heart and brow;</br>Fill me with Thy hallowed presence,</br>Come, O come and fill me now.</br></br>Chorus</br>  Fill me now fill me now,</br>  Jesus, come and fill me now,</br>  Fill me with thy hallowed presence,</br>  Come, o come and fill me now.</br></br>2. Thou canst fill me, gracious Spirit,</br>Though I cannot tell Thee how;</br>But I need Thee, greatly need Thee;</br>Come, O come and fill me now.</br></br>3. I am weakness, full of weakness;</br>At thy sacred feet I bow;</br>Blest, divine, eternal Spirit,</br>Fill with love, and fill me now.</br></br>4. Cleanse and comfort, bless and save me;</br>Bathe, O bathe my heart and brow;</br>Thou art comforting and saving,</br>Thou art sweetly filling now.</br></br> (Composed by Elwood H. Stokes)
title: HOVER O’ER ME

content: Chorus</br>  Bind us together Lord,</br>  Bind us together with cords that cannot be broken.</br>  Bind us together Lord,</br>  Bind us together Lord,</br>  Bind us together with love.</br></br>1. There is only one God,</br>There is only one King;</br>There is only one body,</br>That is why we sing.</br></br>2. Made of the glory of God,</br>Purchased by  His precious blood;</br>Born with the right to be chosen,</br>Jesus the victory won.</br></br>3. You are the family of God,</br>You are the promise divine;</br>You are God’s chosen desire,</br>You are the glorious new wine.</br></br></br>
title: BIND US TOGETHER

content: 1. Silent night, holy night,</br>All is calm, all is bright;</br>Round you virgin mother and Child!</br>Holy Infant, so tender and mild,</br>Sleep in heavenly peace, Sleep in heavenly peace.</br></br>2. Silent night, holy night,</br>Darkness flies, all is light;</br>Shepherds hear the angels sing,</br>“alleluia! Hail the King!</br>Christ the Saviour is born</br>Christ the Saviour is born.”</br></br>3. Silent night, holy night,</br>Son of God, love’s pure light;</br>Radiant beams from Thy holy face</br>With the dawn of redeeming grace,</br>Jesus, Lord, at Thy birth,</br>Jesus, Lord, at Thy birth.</br></br>4. Silent night, holy night,</br>Wondrous star, lend thy light;</br>Alleluia to our King;</br>Christ the saviour is born</br>Christ the Saviour is born</br></br>(Composed by Joseph Mohr)
title: SILENT NIGHT, HOLY NIGHT

content: 1. Marvelous grace of our loving Lord,</br>Grace that exceeds our sin and our guilt!</br>Yonder on Calvary’s mount outpoured-</br>There, where the blood of the Lamb was split.</br></br>Chorus</br>  Grace, grace, God’s grace,</br>  Grace that will pardon and cleanse within;</br>  Grace, grace, God’s grace,</br>  Grace that is greater than all our sin!</br></br>2. Sin and despair, like the sea-waves cold,</br>Threaten the soul with infinite loss;</br>Grace that is greater—yes, grace untold—</br>Points to the refuge, the mighty Cross.</br></br>3. Marvelous, infinite, matchless grace,</br>Freely bestowed on all who believe!</br>You that are longing to see His face,</br>Will you this moment His grace receive?</br></br> (Composed by Julia H. Johnston)
title: MARVELOUS GRACE

content: 1. Away in a manger, no crib for a bed,</br>The little Lord Jesus laid down His sweet head.</br>The stars in the bright sky looked down where He lay,</br>The little Lord Jesus asleep on the hay.</br></br>2. The cattle are lowing the baby awakes,</br>But little Lord Jesus no crying He makes,</br>I love thee, Lord Jesus! Look down from the sky,</br>And stay by side till the morning is nigh.</br></br>3. Be near me , Lord Jesus, I ask Thee to stay</br>Close by me forever, and love me, I pray</br>Bless all the dear children in Thy tender care,</br>And fit us for heaven, to live with Thee there.
title: AWAY IN A MANGER

content: 1. I’m but a stranger here,</br>Heaven is my home,</br>Earth is a desert drear,</br>Heaven is my home,</br>Danger and sorrow stand</br>Round me on every hand;</br>Heaven in my Fatherland</br>Heaven is my home</br></br>2. What though the tempest rage,</br>Heaven is my home;</br>Short is my pilgrimage,</br>Heaven is my home,</br>Time’s cold and wintry blast;</br>Soon will be overpast;</br>I shall reach home at last</br>Heaven is my home.</br></br>3. There at my Saviour’s side,</br>Heaven is my home;</br>I shall be glorified,</br>Heaven is my home.</br>There’ll be the good and blest</br>Those I love most and best,</br>There, too, I soon shall rest;</br>Heaven is my home.</br></br> (Composed by Thomas R. Taylor)
title: I’M BUT A STRANGER HERE

content: 1. When I survey the wondrous cross </br>On which the Prince of glory died,</br>My richest gain I count but loss</br>And pour contempt on all my pride.</br></br>2. Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast,</br>Save in the death of Christ, my God;</br>All the vain things that charm me most-</br>I sacrifice them to His blood.</br></br>3. See, from His head, His hands, His feet,</br>Sorrow and love flow mingled down;</br>Did e’er such love and sorrow meet. </br>Or thorns compose so rich a crown?</br></br>4. Were the whole realm of nature mine,</br>That were a present far too small;</br>Love so amazing so divine,</br>Demands my soul, my life, my all.</br></br>  (Composed by Isaac Watts)
title: WHEN I SURVEY THE WONDROUS CROSS

content: 1. There’s sunshine in my soul today,</br>More glorious and bright</br>Than glows in any earthly sky.</br>For Jesus is my light.</br></br>Chorus</br> O there’s sunshine, blessed sunshine,</br> When the peaceful, happy moments roll;</br> When Jesus shows His smiling face </br> There is sunshine in the soul.</br></br>2. There’s music in my soul today,</br>A carol to my King,</br>And Jesus, listening can hear </br>The songs I cannot sing.</br></br>3. There’s springtime in my soul today</br>For when the Lord is near,</br>The dove of peace sings in my heart,</br>The flowers of grace appear.</br></br>4. There’s gladness in my soul today,</br>And hope, and praise, and love,</br>For blessings which He gives me now,</br>For joys “laid up” above.</br></br> (Composed by Eliza E. Hewiit)</br>
title: THERE’S SUNSHINE IN MY SOUL

content: 1. Once I was a sinner, dwelling today!</br>I need to my Saviour who died for me. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>He lives (2x) he lives within my heart.</br>He rest (2x) He rests within my soul,</br>He walks with me and talk, to me along the narrow way (2x)</br>Praise the Lord (3x)</br></br>Solo: He walks with me and talks to me,</br>Bass: Along the narrow way (4x)</br>All: He lives (2x) He rests within my soul,</br>He walks with me and talks to me along the narrow way (2x)</br>Praise the Lord (3x)</br></br>2. Then I met a man His name is Jesus,</br>He says I am the way the truth and the life. (2x)</br>
title: ONCE I WAS A SINNER

content: 1. Be silent, be silent, A whisper is heard;</br>Be silent, be silent, Oh treasure each word.</br></br>Chorus</br>Tread softly, tread softly,</br>The Master is here,</br>Tread softly, tread softly</br>He bids us draw near.</br></br>2. Be silent, be silent, for holy this place,</br>This alter that echoes the message of grace.</br></br>3. Be silent be silent, Breathe humbly our prayer,</br>A foretaste of Eden. This moment we share.</br></br>4. Be silent be silent, His mercy record;</br>Be silent, be silent and wait on the Lord.</br></br>  (Composed by Fanny J. Crosby)
title: TREAD SOFTLY

content: 1. My faith looks up to Thee,</br>Thou Lamb of Calvary,</br>Saviour divine;</br>Now hear me while me while I pray,</br>Take all my sins away,</br>O let me from this day</br>Be wholly Thine.</br></br>2. May Thy rich grace impart</br>Strength to my fainting heart,</br>My zeal inspire;</br>As Thou hast died for me</br>O may my love to Thee</br>Pure, warm, and changeless be,</br> A living fire.</br></br>3. While life’s dark maze I tread,</br>And griefs around me spread,</br>Be thou my Guide;</br>Bid darkness turn to day,</br>Wipe sorrows tears away</br>Nor let me ever stray </br>From Thee aside.</br></br>  (Composed by Roy Palmer)</br>
title: MY FAITH LOOKS UP TO THEE

content: 1. In the manger long ago, I know it’s really so,</br>A Baby was born to save me from my sin,</br>John saw Him and said a Lamb forever more,</br>Christ died at Calvary. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Solo: hallelujah</br>All: I love, I love that Man of Galilee</br>Bass: But why?</br>All: For He has done so much for me</br>Bass: Like what?</br>All: He has forgiven all my sins there is Holy Ghost in Him,</br>I love, I love that Man of Galilee.</br>(2x)</br></br>2. Nichodemus came by night to know, if the way was right,</br>He asked the Son of Man what he must do,</br>Jesus answer him and said you must be born again,</br>By the Spirit of that man of Galilee. (2x)</br></br>3. The disciples of the Lord they sang a song,</br>And praise and waiting for the Spirit to descend.</br>And soon from above it came power, </br>And light by the Spirit of that Man of Galilee. (2x)</br>
title: IN THE MANGER LONG AGO

content: 1. My faith has found a resting place,</br>Not in a man-made creed;</br>I trust the ever living One,</br>That He for me will plead.</br></br>Chorus</br>I need no other evidence,</br>I need no other plea;</br>It is enough that Jesus died </br>And rose again for me.</br></br>2. Enough for me that Jesus saves,</br>This ends my fear and doubts;</br>A sinful soul I come to Him,</br>He will not cast me out.</br></br>3. My soul is resting on the word </br>The living word of God;</br>Salvation is my Saviour’s name,</br>Salvation through His blood.</br></br>4. The great Physician heals the sick</br>The lost He came to save,</br>For me His precious blood He shed;</br>For me His life He gave.</br></br>  (Composed by Lidie H. Edmunds)</br>
title: MY FAITH HAS FOUND A RESTING PLACE

content: 1. Waiting up in heaven, there is a golden gate,</br>Where the Lord is waiting for you and for me.</br>Waiting to receive so He has saved us now,</br>Come and join us there  to sing and praise the Lord our God.</br></br>Chorus</br>We shall sing and praising in the golden gate,</br>Praising our Lord and Saviour all the day and night.</br>We shall tell the goodness of the Lord our God,</br>Come and join us there is to sing and praise the Lord our God.</br></br>2. Surely in the golden gate there is open door,</br>Now we go to heaven not through that one door.</br>Jesus is there waiting, waiting to receive come and meet</br>There to sing and praise the Lord our God. (2x)</br>
title: WAITING UP IN HEAVEN

content: 1. It’s time to practice what the Bible has taught</br>Entrust to faithfulness who will also do the same. (2x)</br></br>2. Tell them the gospel the gospel of the grace,</br>The gospel of salvation and eternal life. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Solo: You just pack and go</br>All: You just pack and go</br>Bass: Towards Jerusalem</br>All: you just pack and go</br>All: Towards Samaria</br>All: you just pack and go</br>Bass: Towards Judea</br>All: You just pack and go</br>Solo: Corner of the world</br>All: You just pack and go</br>Solo: Corner of het world</br>All: You just pack and go</br>Packing up, packing up, packing. (2x)</br>
title: IT’S TIME TO PRACTICE

content: 1. Worthy, worthy is the Lamb,</br>Worthy, worthy is the Lamb,</br>Worthy, worthy is the Lamb that was slain.</br></br>Chorus</br>Glory, halleluiah! Praise Him,</br>Halleluiah! </br>Glory, hallelujah, to the Lamb!</br></br>2. Savior, let Thy kingdom come!</br>Now the power of sin consume;</br>Bring Thy blest millennium,</br>Holy Lamb.</br></br>3. Thus may we each moment feel,</br>Love Him, serve Him,, praise Him still,</br>Till we all on Zion’s hill </br>See the Lamb</br>
title: WORTHY, WORTHY IS THE LAMB

content: 1. I cannot tell why He whom angels worship</br>Should set His love upon the souls of men,</br>Or why as Shepherd He should seek the wanderers,</br>To bring them back, they know not how nor when.</br>But this I know—that He was born of Mary</br>When Bethlehem’s manger was His only home,</br>And  that He lived at Nazareth and laboured;</br>And so the Saviour,  Saviour of the world, has come.</br></br>2. I cannot tell how silently He suffered </br>As with His peace He graced this place of tears,</br>Now how His heart upon the cross was broken,</br>The crown of pain to three and thirty years.</br>But this I know—He heals the broken hearted</br>And stays our sin and calms our lurking fear,</br>And lifts the burden from the heavy laden;</br>For still the Saviour, Saviour of the world, is here.</br></br>3. I cannot tell how the lands will worship,</br>When at His bidding every storm is stilled</br>Or who can say how great the jubilation</br>When all our hearts with love for Him are filled</br>But this I know—the skies shall sound His praises,</br>Ten thousand thousand human voices sing,</br>And earth to heaven, and heaven to earth will answer,</br>At last the Saviour, Saviour of the world is King!</br></br>       (Composed by W. Y . Fullerton)
title: I CANNOT TELL WHY

content: 1. Baptize us anew</br>With power from on high</br>With love, O refresh us!</br>Dear Saviour, draw nigh.</br></br>Chorus</br>We humbly besech Thee, Lord </br>Jesus, we pray</br>With love and the Spirit baptizes us today.</br></br>2. Unworthy we cry,</br>Unholy, unclean,</br>O wash us and cleanse us </br>From sin’s guilty stain.</br></br>3. O heavenly Dove,</br>Descend from on high!</br>We plead Thy rich blessing;</br>In mercy draw nigh.</br></br>4. O list the glad voice!</br>From heaven it came;</br>Thou art My beloved</br>Well please I am.</br></br>(after last verse)</br>We praise Thee, we bless Thee,</br>Dear Lamb that was slain,</br>We laud and adore Thee,</br>Amen and Amen.</br></br>(Composed by Williams A. Ogden)
title: BAPTIZE US ANEW

content: 1. I surrender to the Lord long time ago,</br>Who came as flesh Oh glory be to God and peace be unto men,</br>On earth sinner we have crucified Him,</br>The world away from the grave of shame,</br>What can I say, what will I do,</br>I can’t believe this mighty Grace. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Shall I bring silver or gold.</br>To take away my terrible sin,</br>Will a single cent even what will reconcile me to God on earth,</br>(what can I say 2x)</br>The Son of God who paid the price</br>What can I say, what will I do</br>I can’t believe this mighty grace. (2x)</br></br>2. Jesus went to the Mount of Olives until the morning came again,</br>In the temple where Pharisees came,</br>The people, like the crowd, they brought this woman caught in sin,</br>“Master she should be stoned now,”</br>“He that without a sin,</br>Let him first cast a stone at her.”</br>
title: I SURRENDER TO THE LORD

content: 1. Just one touch as He moves along,</br>Pushed and passed by the joining throng;</br>Just one touch and the weak was strong,</br>Cured by the Healer divine.</br></br>Chorus</br>Just one touch as He passed by,</br>He will lead you to the faintest cry,</br>Come and be saved while the Lord is nigh,</br>Christ is the Healer divine.</br></br>2. Just one touch by His mighty power,</br>He can heal thee this very hour.</br>Give peace to the tempest lower,</br>Cured by the Healer divine.</br></br>3. Just one touch and He made me white,</br>Speak sweet peace to my sin;</br>Sick soul, at His feet all my burdens roll,</br>Cured by the Healer divine.</br>
title: JUST ONE TOUCH

content: 1. Lo! He comes with clouds descending,</br>Once for favoured sinners slain;</br>Countless angels, Him attending,</br>Swell the triumph of His train,</br>Hallelujah! Hallelujah!</br>Jesus comes, and come to reign.</br></br>2. Every eye shall now behold Him,</br>Robed in dreadful majesty!</br>Those who set at nought and sold Him,</br>Pierced, and nailed Him to the tree,</br>Deeply wailing, deeply wailing</br>Shall the true Messiah see!</br></br>3. When the solemn trump has sounded,</br>Heaven and earth shall fee away;</br>All who hate Him, must confounded,</br>Hear the summons of that day--- </br>“Come to judgment! Come  to judgment!</br>Come to judgment! Come away!”</br></br>4. Yea amen! Le all adore Thee,</br>High on thy eternal throne!</br>Saviour, take the power and glory,</br>Make thy righteous sentences known;</br>O come quickly, O come quickly,</br>Claim the kingdom for thine own!
title: LO! HE COMES

content: 1.
