Enter, rejoice and come in (2x)</br>Today will be a joyful day;</br>Enter, rejoice and come in</br></br>Chorus</br>Sing hallelujah, sing halelujah,</br>Today will be a joyful day,</br>Sing halleluja!</br></br>2. Lift up your voice to the Lord (2x)</br>Today will be a joyful day,</br>Lift up your voice to the Lord.</br></br>3. Open your heart to the Lord, (2x)</br>Today will be a joyful dayl;</br>Open your heart to the Lord</br></br>Chorus</br>Sing hallelujah! (2x)</br>Today will be a joyful day,</br>Sing hallelujah!</br>
title: ENTER, REJOICE AND COME IN

content: 1. Praise the Lord, O ye people!</br>Praise the Lord His holiness,</br>Praise the Lord, O ye people!</br>Praise the Lord His holiness. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Come to Jesus, O ye people,</br>He will be giving you rest,</br>Take His yoke upon you,</br>And learn of His great love. (2x)</br></br>2. All my brothers and all sisters,</br>Praise the Lord His holiness;</br>All my brothers and all sisters,</br>Praise the Lord His holiness (2x)</br></br>3. Hallelujah! We have seen His love,</br>Hallelujah! Amen;</br>Hallelujah! We have seen His love,</br>Hallelujah! Amen</br>
title: PRAISE THE LORD, O YE PEOPLE!

content: 1. Though the world has forsaken God,</br>Walks a different path, lives a different way,</br> I walk the road that my Saviour trod,</br>And all may know I live under Jesus’ sway.</br></br>Chorus</br>They are watching you, marking all you do,</br>Hearing the things you say;</br>Let them see the Saviour as He shines in you,</br>Let His power control you every day.</br></br>2. Man will look at the life I lead,</br>See the side I take and the things I love;</br>They judge my Lord by my every deed–</br>Lord, set my affections on things above.</br></br>3. When assailed in temptation’s hour,</br>By besetting sins, by the fear of man;</br>When I can know Jesus’ mighty power,</br>And become like Him in His perfect plan.</br></br>4. Here on earth people walk in night,</br>With no Lamb to guide they are dead in sin;</br>I know the Lord who can give them light,</br>I live, yet not I , but Christ within.</br>
title: THOUGH THE WORLD

content: 1. Dear friend, I am leaving now—I the train city boy,</br>To take me and my body over there;</br>The Land of paradise, where there is no suffering,</br>No sorrow, no worries at all. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>It’s okay, it’s okay in the train, in the train,</br>It’s ok, well, my dear it’s okay,</br>The land of paradise where there is no suffering,</br>No sorrow, no worries at all. (2x)</br></br>2. I am afraid of paradise and I know the reason why,</br>We shall never meet until we meet the Lord;</br>The land of paradise where there is suffering,</br>No sorrow, no worries at all. (2x)
title: DEAR FRIEND, I AM LEAVING

content: (J. B. Coats)</br>1. Living below in this old sinful world,</br>Hardly a comfort can afford;</br>Striving alone to face temptation sore,</br>Where could I  go but to the Lord?</br></br>Chorus</br>Where could I go, where could I go,</br>Seeking a refuge for my soul?</br>Needing a friend to help me in the end,</br>Where could I go but to the Lord?</br></br>2. Neighbours are kind---I love them everyone,</br>We get along in sweet accord;</br>But when my soul needs manna from above,</br>Where could I go but to the Lord?</br></br>3. Life here is grand with friends I love so dear,</br>Comfort I get form God’s own word;</br>Yet when I face the chilling hands of death,</br>Where cold I go but to the Lord?</br>
title: WHERE COULD I GO?

content: Chorus</br> Jesus never fails, Jesus never fails;</br> The man of this world will let you down,</br> But Jesus never fails. (2x)</br></br>1. Your brother will let you down,</br>Your sister will let you down;</br>The man of this world will let you down,</br>But Jesus never fails. (2x)</br></br>2. Your father will let you down,</br>Your mother will let you down;</br>The man of this world will let you down,</br>But Jesus never fails. (2x)</br></br>3. Your boy friend will let you down,</br>Your girlfriend will let you down;</br>The man of this world will let you down,</br>But Jesus never fails. (2x)</br>
title: JESUS NEVER FAILS

content: 1 O, Laodicea to be not to see rise up and up among women.</br></br>Chorus</br>Brothers, sisters let’s work together,</br>For the sixth kingdom is now at end.</br></br>2. Fellow refugee our’s the seventh,</br>Are you ready to enter?</br></br>3. Brother, sister recall your motto that says,</br>“Fear God and give glory to Him.”</br></br>4. Hallelujah, hallelujah praise be to God,</br>We are His own.</br>
title: O, LAODICEA

content: 1. When I tune the time only to hear the sound of battle around the world,</br>This one has proved to me that He is coming – </br>Jesus is coming is coming very soon. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>(He’s coming again. (2x)</br>He’s almost He’s almost to be. (2x)</br></br>2. When I tune the time only to hear the sound of peace around the world,</br>This has proved to me that He is coming –</br>Jesus is coming is coming very soon. (2x)</br></br>3. Brother we have to be daily in prayers.</br>The King is coming to take us home;</br>When we have not to be,</br>How shall we stand before the Saviour for that we deserved? (2x)</br>
title: WHEN I TUNE THE TIME

content: Chorus</br> Holy, holy to the Lord,</br> When you look at the dawning you may wonder how they appear, </br> so beautiful shining – showing marvelous word of God. (2x)</br></br>1. When you look at the people,</br>You may wonder how they appear beautiful shining.</br>Showing marvelous word of God,</br>When you look at the people</br>You may wonder how some appear bright the day,</br>Jealous is Satan.</br></br>2. When you look at the creatures,</br>You may wonder how they appear so beautiful shining.</br>Showing marvelous word of God.</br>When you look at the dawning stars,</br>You wonder how some appear,</br>Bright the day—jealous, jealous is Satan.</br>
title: HOLY, HOLY TO THE LORD

content: 1. Holy day, Jehovah’s rest of creation week the best,</br>Last of all the chosen seven, blessed of God, to man it was given.</br></br>Chorus</br>Solo: Welecome, welcome 2x</br>Bass: Welcome, welcome ever welcome,</br>All: Glad we hail its presence blessed. It’s the great Jehovah’s rest.</br></br>2. First six days work was gone,</br>Then the Sabbath was begun;</br>Thus He blessed the seventh day,</br>Thus in resting we obey.</br></br>3. Thousand have His plan reversed,</br>Resting now upon the first;</br>Search the book and you shall know,</br>There is no scripture tells them so.</br></br>4. Those who speak the truth must joy,</br>It was man who changed the day,</br>In God’s word no change appears,</br>Through the whole six thousand years.</br></br>5. Thus I circle when I show,</br>Only one great Sabbath Law;</br>Then I hasten turn to obey,</br>Plainly it was the only day.</br>
title: HOLY DAY, JEHOVAH’S REST

content: (Lewis Hartsough)</br>1. I hear Thy welcome voice,</br>That calls me, Lord to Thee;</br>For cleansing in Thy precious blood,</br>That flowed on Calvary.</br></br>Chorus</br>I am coming Lord!</br>Coming now to Thee!</br>Wash me, cleanse me, in the blood</br>That flowed on Calvary.</br></br>2. Though coming weak and vile,</br>Thou dost my strength assure;</br>Thou dost my vileness fully cleanse,</br>Till spotless all, and pure.</br></br>3. ‘Tis Jesus calls me on</br>To perfect faith and love,</br>To perfect hope, and peace, and trust</br>For earth and heaven above.</br></br>4. All hail, atoning blood!</br>All hail, redeeming grace!</br>All hail, the gift of Christ, our Lord,</br>Our Strength and Reighteousness.</br>
title: I HEAR THY WELCOME VOICE

content: Chorus</br>Wake up! My people,</br>Wake up, give a shout!</br>Wake up1 My people, know what life’s about and </br>Wake up to the needs of all the ones who suffer sorrow.</br>Wake up and promise now to do your best to change tomorrow,</br>Wake up! My people and open ev’ry door.</br>Wake up! It’s time now1</br>Love My people evermore.</br></br>1. All across the nation,</br>People are waiting hungry people,</br>Starving waiting hopefully,</br>Wake up My people, share your table with them,</br>As often as you do these things, you do the same for me.</br></br>2. Living in our cities, people are waiting, lonesome people, lonely, waiting hopefully,</br>Wake up to My people, listen to their story,</br>As often as you do these things you do the same form Me.</br></br>3. Even in our families, people are waiting,</br>Someone might be crying, waiting hopefully,</br>Wake up to My people, dry their tears of sorrow,</br>As often as you do these things you do the same for Me.</br>
title: WAKE UP! MY PEOPLE

content: 1. Jesus my Lord, my God, my all, </br>Hear me, O Saviour, when I call,</br>Hear me,</br>From the dwelling place pour down </br>Thy riches of Your own.</br></br>Chorus</br>Jesus my Saviour, whom I adore help me,</br>(To love you more and more ( 2x) </br>Bass: Oh, oh help me to love you more and more.</br></br>2. Jesus, too late, I searched for You,</br>To pay the debt of love I owe;</br>How can I sing Your worthy name,</br>The glorious beauty of your name.</br></br>3. Jesus how strong Your love to me,</br>That You should come and die for me;</br>How great the joy that you have brought,</br>So far exceeding hope I thought.</br></br>4. Jesus Your Love shall be my song,</br>To You my heart and soul belong;</br>My life is yours, O Lord divine,</br>And You , dear Savior, You are mine.</br>
title: JESUS MY LORD, MY GOD

content: 1. Is there a heart that is waiting,</br>Longing for pardon today?</br>Hear the glad message we bring you,</br>“Jesus is passing this way”</br></br>Chorus</br>Solo: Jesus is passing this way,</br>This way, today (2x)</br>Bass: Today (4x)</br>All: He’s passing this way today.</br></br>2. Coming in love and in mercy </br>Quickly now unto Him;</br>Open your heart to receive Him,</br>Pardon for peace will be yours.</br></br>3. Listen the Spirit is calling,</br>Jesus will freely forgive;</br>Why not this moment accept Him,</br>Trust in God’s mercy and live.</br></br>4. He is so tender and loving,</br>He is so near today;</br>Open your heart to receive Him,</br>While He is passing this way.</br>
title: PASSING THIS WAY

content: (P.P. Bliss)</br>1. Sing them over again to me,</br>Wonderful words of life;</br>Let me more of their beauty see,</br>Wonderful words of life.</br>Words of life and beauty,</br>Teach me faith and duty;</br></br>Chorus</br>Beautiful words, wonderful words,</br>Wonderful words of life,</br>Beautiful words, wonderful words,</br>Wonderful words of life,</br></br>2. Christ, the blessed One, gives to all</br>Wonderful words of life;</br>Sinner, list to the loving call,</br>Wonderful words of life.</br>All so freely given,</br>Wooing us to heaven (Refrain)</br></br>3. Sweetly echo the gospel call,</br>Wonderful words of life;</br>offer pardon and peace to all,</br>Wonderful words of life.</br>Jesus, only Saviour,</br>sanctify forever;(refrain)
title: WONDERFUL WORDS OF LIFE

content: 1. The Lord said, “Stand up, Paul and dry your tears,</br>You must preach my gospel for many long years;</br>Go down to Damascus the way that you stay,</br>You will meet Ananias and there you must wait.” (2x)</br></br>2.“I counted on Adam, I counted on Jonah,</br>I counted on Cain, but he was not saved;</br>I counted on Judas but he proved untrue,</br>O, go and tell the world – Paul</br>I am counting on you.” (2x)</br></br>3. I will send you to the Gentiles, I will send you to Rome,</br>But Paul you must suffer till I call you home;</br>You will sleep in the desert, you sleep in the sea,</br>But keep on preaching this gospel for me (2x)</br></br>4. Three days have gone by, my Lord I don’t see,</br>But here calls my brother, he’s talking to me,</br>He says, “Brother Paul, the Lord in the sky</br>Has sent me to heal you, and open your eyes. (2x)</br>
title: STAND UP PAUL

content: 1. I want to be with Jesus when the trumpet sounds,</br>I have got to be ready when my Lord descends. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Oh Jesus in the  blue sky, in the blue sky,</br>My Saviour, coming in the clouds, hear the angels sing. (2x)</br></br>2. My life here has been worrying here the Saviour say,</br>Oh come to me the weary I will give you rest. (2x)</br></br>3. Remember the Advent message to the generation,</br>Adventist youth remember bear the light to all. (2x)</br></br>Hallelu, hallelujah, amen, (4x)</br>AYS win one for the Lord (3x)</br>Maa Yesu, nina bi naja (3x)</br>
title: I WANT TO BE WITH JESUS

content: (Will L . Thompson)</br>1. Softly and tenderly Jesus is calling,</br>Calling for you and for me;</br>At the heart’s portal He’s waiting  and watching,</br>Watching for you and for me.</br></br>Chorus</br>Come home, come home,</br>Ye who are weary come home;</br>Earnestly, tenderly Jesus is calling,</br>Calling, “O sinner, come home!”</br></br>2. Why should we tarry when Jesus is calling,</br>Calling for you and for me?</br>Why should we linger and heed not His mercies,</br>Mercies for you and form?</br></br>3. Think of the wonderful love He has promised,</br>Promised for you and for me;</br>Though we have sinned He has mercy and pardon,</br>Pardon for you and for me.</br>
title: SOFTLY AND TENDERLY

content: (Fanny J. Crosby)</br>1. To God be the glory, great things He hath done,</br>So loved He the world that He gave us His Son;</br>Who yielded His life an atonement for sin,</br>And opened the life gate that all may go in.</br></br>Chorus</br>Praise the Lord, praise the Lord,</br>Let the earth hear His voice;</br>Praise the Lord, praise the Lord.</br>Let the people rejoice.</br>O, come to the Father through Jesus the Son,</br>And give Him the glory, great things He has done.</br></br>2. O perfect redemption, the purchase of blood,</br>To every believer the promise of God;</br>A vilest offender who truly believes,</br>That moment from Jesus a pardon receives.</br></br>3. Great things He hath taught us, great things He hath done;</br>And great our rejoicing through the Son,</br>But purer, and higher, and greater will be,</br>Our wonder, our transport, when Jesus we see.</br>
title: TO GOD BE THE GLORY

content: (J. B. O. Clemm)</br>1. Far and near the fields are teeming</br>With the sheaves of ripened grain;</br>Far and near their gold is gleaming</br>O’er, the sunny slope and plain.</br></br>Chorus</br>Lord of harvest, send forth reapers!</br>Hear us, Lord, to Thee we cry;</br>Send them now the sheaves to gather,</br>Ere the harvest time pass by.</br></br>2. Send them forth with morn’s first beaming,</br>Send them in the noon-tide’s glare;</br>When the sun’s last rays are streaming,</br>Bid them gather everywhere.</br></br>3. O thou, whom thy Lord is sending,</br>Gather now the sheaves of gold;</br>Heavenward then at evening wending,</br>Thou shalt come with joy un-told.
title: FAR AND NEAR

content: Chorus</br> Everybody ought to know,</br> Everybody ought to know,</br> Everybody ought to know,</br> Who Jesus is.</br></br>1. He’s the lily of the valley,</br>He’s the bright and morning star;</br>He’s the fairest of ten thousand,</br>Everybody ought to know.</br></br>2. On the cross the died for sinners,</br>And His blood makes white as snow;</br>Loving, living, coming Saviour,</br>He’s the One you ought to know.</br>
title: EVERY BODY OUGHT TO KNOW

content: (Fanny J. Crosby)</br>1. All the way my Saviour leads me,</br>What have I to ask beside?</br>Can I doubt His tender mercy,</br>Who through life has been my Guide?</br>Heavenly peace, divinest comfort,</br>Here by faith in Him to dwell,</br>For I know what’er befall me,</br>Jesus doeth all things well;</br>For I know what’er befall me,</br>Jesus doeth all things well.</br></br>2. All the way my Saviour leads me,</br>Cheers each winding path I tread;</br>Gives me grace for every trial,</br>Feeds me with the living Bread.</br>Though my weary steps may falter,</br>And my soul athirst may be,</br>Gushing from the Rock before me,</br>Lo, a spring of joy I see;</br>Gushing from the Rock before me,</br>Lo, a spring of joy I see.</br></br>3. All the way my Saviour leads me,</br>O, the fullness of His love!</br>Perfect rest to me is promised,</br>In my Father’s house above.</br>When I wake to life immortal,</br>Wing my flight to realms of day;</br>This is my song through endless ages,</br>Jesus led me all the way;</br>This is my song through endless ages,</br>Jesus led me all the way.
title: ALL THE WAY

content: (Emmanuel Francis)</br>1. Who will guide us as the Lord?</br>There is no one, only God. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>There is power, power, power,</br>There is power over power of death. (2x)</br></br>2. As Jesus rose from death,</br>Who’re asleep will rise to life. (2x)</br></br>3. As Jesus rose from death,</br>All the Saints will rise to life. (2x)</br></br>4. We have guarantee in Jesus Christ,</br>Who’re asleep will rise to life. (2x)
title: WHO WILL GUIDE US

content: (Annie S. Hawks)</br>1. I need Thee every hour,</br>Most gracious Lord;</br>No tender voice like Thine,</br>Can peace afford.</br></br>Chorus</br>I need Thee, O, I need Thee,</br>Every hour I need Thee!</br>O bless me now, my Saviour,</br>I come to Thee.</br></br>2. I need Thee every hour,</br>Stay Thou near by;</br>Temptations lose their power</br>When Thou art nigh.</br></br>3. I need Thee every hour,</br>In joy or pain;</br>Come quickly and abide,</br>Or Life is vain.</br></br>4. I need Thee every hour,</br>Teach me Thy will;</br>And Thy rich promises,</br>In me fulfill.</br>
title: I NEED THEE EVERY HOUR

content: (Philip Doddridge)</br>1. O happy day! That fixed my choice,</br>On Thee my Saviour and my God;</br>Well may this glowing heart rejoice,</br>And tell its raptures all around.</br></br>Chorus</br>Happy day, happy day,</br>When Jesus washed my sins away!</br>He taught me how to watch and pray.</br>And live rejoicing every day,</br>Happy day, happy day,</br>When Jesus washed my sins away.</br></br>2. ‘Tis done, the great transaction’s done;</br>I am my Lord’s and He is mine;</br>He drew me and I followed on,</br>Charmed to confess the voice divine:</br></br>3. Now rest, my long divided heart,</br>Fixed on this blissful center, rest;</br>Nor ever from my Lord depart,</br>With Him of every good possessed.</br></br>4. And when the bright celestrial train,</br>From highest heaven to earth shall come;</br>Then with my Lord I’ll rise and reign,</br>For ever in that happy home.</br>
title: O HAPPY DAY

content: 1. When I think from where you brought me,</br>From deep muddy clay,</br>You put my feet on the rock and I will sing to you. (2x)</br></br>Chorus</br>Solo: I love you Lord, I praise you name</br>Bass: I love you Lord with all my heart. (2x)</br></br>2. You are the Jehovah Healer,</br>You are the Jehovah Sovereign,</br>The rocks of salvation and I will sing to You. (2x)</br></br>3. Join me to sing His praises,</br>Join me to sing His name</br>The Lord is good to very one,  and I will sing to Him. (2x)</br>
title: WHEN I THINK

content: (Franklin E. Belden)</br>1. O Jesus, my Redeemer,</br>Thou art my joy and song;</br>My Saviour and my solace</br>When grief’s around me throng.</br></br>Chorus</br>O Jesus, my Redeemer,</br>My son shall be of Thee;</br>No other friend so constant,</br>No friends so dear to me.</br></br>2. Thou art my hope and  comfort,</br>Through all the weary years;</br>When shadows dark surround me,</br>When fall the bitter tears.</br></br>3. I trust in Thee, my Saviour,</br>My faithful Friend and Guide;</br>For Thou to me art dearer.</br>Than all on earth beside.</br></br>4. My son and my rejoicing,</br>While in this world of sin;</br>My son and my rejoicing,</br>The heavenly gates within.</br>
title: O JESUS, MY REDEEMER

content: 1. The Lord has done so much for me,</br>That I can not tell it all,</br>He has done so much for me, my Lord. (2x)</br></br>Solo: Oh…oh</br>All: What a joy there will be. (4x)</br>When I see my Lord.</br></br>2. The Lord has done so much for you,</br>That you can not tell it all,</br>He has done so much for you, your Lord. (2x)</br></br>Solo: Oh…oh</br>All: What a joy there will be (4x)</br>When you see you Lord.</br></br>3. The Lord has done so much for us,</br>That we can not tell it all;</br>He has done so much for us, our Lord. (2x)</br></br>Solo: Oh…oh</br>All: What a joy there will be  (4x)</br>Bass: the Lord has done so much for me,</br>That I can not tell it all,</br>He has done so much for me my Lord.</br>Bass: Oh..oh</br>All: what a joy that will be (4x)</br>When I see you Lord.</br>
title: THE LORD HAS DONE

content: (William Ralf Featherstone)</br>1. My Jesus, I love Thee, I know Thou art mine,</br>For Thee all the follies of sin I resign;</br>My gracious Redeemer, my Saviour art Thou,</br>If ever I love Thee, my Jesus ‘tis now.</br></br>2. I love Thee because Thou has first loved me.</br>And purchased my pardon on Calvary’s tree;</br>I love Thee for wearing the thorns on Thy brow,</br>If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus ‘tis now.</br></br>3. I’ll love Thee in life, I will love Thee in death;</br>And praise Thee as long as Thou lendest me breath;</br>And say when the death dew lies cold on my brow,</br>If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, ‘tis now.</br>In mansions of glory and endless delight,</br></br>4. I'll ever adore thee in Heaven so bright;</br>I'll sing with the glittering crown on my brow,</br>if ever i loved thee, my Jesus, 'tis now
title: MY JESUS I LOVE THEE

content: (John Newton)</br>1. Safely through another week,</br>God has brought us on our way;</br>Let us now a blessing seek,</br>Waiting in His courts today;</br>Day of all the week the best</br>Emblem of eternal rest.</br>Day of all the week the best</br>Emblem of eternal rest.</br></br>2. While we seek supplies of grace,</br>Through the dear Redeemer’s name,</br>Show Thy reconciling face,</br>Take away our sin and shame;</br>From our worldly cares set free,</br>May we rest this day in Thee.</br>From our worldly cares set free,</br>May we rest this day in Thee.</br></br>3. When the morn shall bid us rise</br>May we feel Thy presence near,</br>May Thy glory meet our eyes</br>When we in Thy house appear;</br>Here afford us, Lord, a taste;</br>Of our everlasting feast,</br>Here afford us, Lord, a taste, </br>Of our eversting feast.</br></br>4. May the gospel’s joyful sound</br>Conquer sinners, comfort saints;</br>Make the fruits of grace abound,</br>Bring relief to all complaints;</br>Thus may all our Sabbaths be,</br>Till we rise to reign with Thee;</br>Thus may all our Sabbaths be,</br>Till we rise to reign with Thee.</br>
title: SAFELY THROUGH ANOTHER WEEK

content: (Jessie E. Strout)</br>1. Lift up the trumpet and loud let it ring;</br>Jesus is coming again!</br>Cheer up, ye pilgrims, be joyful and sing;</br>Jesus is coming again!</br></br>Chorus</br>Coming again, coming again,</br>Jesus is coming again!</br></br>2. Echo it, hilltops; proclaim it, ye plains:</br>Jesus is coming again!</br>Coming in glory, the Lamb that was slain;</br>Jesus is coming again</br></br>3. Heavings of earth, tell the vast,</br>Wondering throng;</br>Jesus is coming again!</br>Tempest and whirlwinds, the anthem prolong;</br>Jesus is coming again!</br></br>4. Nations are angry—by this we do know,</br>Jesus is coming again!</br>Knowledge increases; men run to and fro;</br>Jesus is coming again!</br>
title: LIFT UP THE TRUMPET

content: (Sarah F. Adams)</br>1. Nearer, my God, to Thee, nearer to Thee!</br>E-en though it be a cross that raiseth me!</br>Still all my song shall be,</br>Nearer, my God, to Thee,</br>Nearer, my God, to Thee,</br>Nearer to Thee.</br></br>2. Though like a wanderer, daylight all gone,</br>Darkness be over me, my rest a stone;</br>Yet in my dreams I’d be </br>Nearer, my God to Thee,</br>Nearer, my God, to Thee,</br>Nearer to Thee.</br></br>3. There let the way appear, steps up to heaven;</br>All that Thou sendest me, in mercy given;</br>Angels to beckon me,</br>Nearer, my God, to Thee,</br>Nearer, my God, to Thee,</br>Nearer to Thee.</br></br>4. Then, with my waking thoughts, bright with thy praise,</br>Out of my stony griefs, Bethel I’ll raise;</br>So by my woes to be,</br>Nearer, my God, to Thee,</br>Nearer, my God, to Thee,</br>Nearer to Thee</br></br>5. Or if, on joyful wing, cleaving the sky,</br>Sun, moon, and stars forgot, upward I fly,</br>Still all my song shall be,</br>Nearer my God, to Thee,</br>Nearer, my God, to Thee,</br>Nearer to Thee.</br>
title: NEARER MY GOD, TO THEE

content: (Fanny J. Crosby)</br>1. Tell me the story of Jesus,</br>Write on my heart every word,</br>Tell me the story most precious,</br>Sweetest that ever was heard;</br>Tell how the angels, in chorus,</br>Sang as they welcomed His birth,</br>Glory to God in the highest,</br>Peace and good tidings to earth.</br></br>Chorus</br>Tell me the story of Jesus,</br>Write on my heart every word;</br>Tell me the story most precious,</br>Sweetest that ever was heard.</br></br>2. Fasting alone in the desert,</br>Tell of the days that He passed;</br>How for our sins He was tempted,</br>Yet was triumphant at last;</br>Tell of the years of His labour,</br>Tell of the sorrow He bore;</br>He was despised and afflicted,</br>Homeless, rejected and poor.</br></br>3. Tell of the cross where they nailed Him,</br>Writhing in anguish and pain;</br>Tell of the grave where they laid Him;</br>Tell how He liveth again;</br>Love in that story so tender,</br>Clearer than ever I see;</br>Stay, let me weep while you whisper</br>Love paid the ransom for me.</br>
title: TELL ME THE STORY OF JESUS

content: (Gloria and William J. Gaither)</br>1. God sent His Son, they called Him Jesus,</br>He came to love, heal, and forgive;</br>He lived and died to buy my pardon,</br>An empty grave is there to prove my Saviour lives.</br></br>Chorus</br>Because He lives I can face tomorrow,</br>Because  He lives all fear is gone;</br>Because I know He holds the future.</br>And life is worth the living just because He lives.</br></br>2. How sweet to hold a newborn baby, </br>And feel the pride, and joy He gives;</br>But greater still the calm assurance,</br>This child can face uncertain days </br>  because He lives.</br>
title: BEACUASE HE LIVES

content: (Willliam Hunter)</br>1. The Great Physician now is near,</br>The sympathizing Jesus;</br>He speaks, the drooping heart to cheer,</br>O hear the voices of Jesus!</br></br>Chorus</br>Sweetest note in seraph song,</br>Sweetest name on mortal tongue;</br>Sweetest carol ever sung—</br>Jesus, blessed Jesus!</br></br>2. All glory to the dying Lamb!</br>I now believe in Jesus;</br>I love the blessed Saviour’s name,</br>I love the name of Jesus.</br></br>3. His name dispels my guilt and fear,</br>No other name but Jesus;</br>O how my soul delights to hear,</br>The precious name of Jesus.</br></br>4. And when He comes to bring the crown—</br>The crown of life and glory—</br>Then by His side we will sit down,</br>And tell redemption’s story.</br>
title: THE GREAT PHYSICIAN

content: (Edwin Othello Excell)</br>1. I have a song I love to sing,</br>Since I have been redeemed;</br>O my Redeemer, Saviour, King,</br>Since I have been redeemed.</br></br>Chorus</br>Since I have been redeemed,</br>Since I have been redeemed;</br>I will glory in His name,</br>Since I have been redeemed ,</br>I will glory in my Saviour’s name.</br></br>2. I have Christ that satisfies</br>Since I have been redeemed;</br>To do His will my highest prize,</br>Since I have been redeemed.</br></br>3. I have a witness, bright and clear,</br>Since I have been redeemed;</br>Dispelling every doubt and fear,</br>Since I have been redeemed.</br></br>4. I have a home prepared for me,</br>Since I have been redeemed;</br>Where I shall dwell eternally,</br>Since I have been redeemed.</br>
title: I HAVE A SONG I LOVE TO SING

content: (Charlotte Elliot)</br>1. Just as I am, without one plea,</br>But that Thy blood was shed for me;</br>And that Thou bid’st me come to Thee</br>O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</br></br>2. Just as I am, and waiting not</br>To rid my soul of one dark blot;</br>To thee whose blood can cleanse each spot</br>O lamb of God, I come, I come</br></br></br>3. Just as I am, though tossed about</br>With many a conflict, many a doubt;</br>“Fighting within, and fears without,”</br>O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</br></br>4. Just as I am, poor, wretched, blind;</br>Sight, riches, healing of the mind;</br>Yea, all I need, in Thee in find,</br>O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</br></br>4. Just as I am, Thy love I own</br>Has broken every barrier down;</br>Now to be Thine, and Thine alone,</br>O Lamb of God, I come, I come.</br>
title: JUST AS I AM

content: (Jeremiah Eames Rankin)</br>1. God be with you till we meet again;</br>By His counsels guide, uphold you,</br>With His sheep securely fold you;</br>God be with you till we meet again.</br></br>Chorus </br>T’ll we meet, till we meet,</br>Till we meet at Jesus ‘ feet,</br>Till we meet, till we meet,</br>God be with you till we meet again.</br></br>2. God be with you till we meet again,</br>“Neath His wings protecting hide you;</br>Daily manna still provide you,</br>God be with you till we meet again</br></br>3. God  be with you till we meet again,</br>When life’s perils thick confound you,</br>Put His arms unfailing round you,</br>God be with you till we meet again.</br></br>4. God be with you till we meet again,</br>Keep love’s banner floating o’er you;</br>Smite death’s threatening wave before you,</br>God be with you till we meet again.</br>
title: GOD BE WITH YOU

content: (Civilla D. Martin)</br>1. Be not dismayed whate’er betide,</br>God will take care of you,</br>Beneath His wings of love abide,</br>God will take care of you.</br></br>Chorus</br>God will take care of you,</br>Through everyday, o’er all the way;</br>He will take care of you,</br>God will take care of you.</br></br>2. Through days of toil when your heart doth fail.</br>God will take care of you.</br>When dangers fierce your path assail,</br>God will take care of you.</br></br>3. All you may need He will provide,</br>God will take care of you;</br>Nothing you ask will be denied,</br>God will take care of you.</br></br>4. No matter what may be the test,</br>God will take care of you;</br>Lean, weary one, upon His breast,</br>God will take care of you.</br>
title: GOD WILL TAKE CARE OF YOU

content: ( John W. Peterson )</br>1. O what a wonderful, wonderful day,</br>Day I will never forget;</br>After I’d wandered in darkness away,</br>Jesus my Saviour I  met.</br>O what a tender, compassionate friend—</br>He met the need of my heart;</br>Shadows dispelling, with joy I am telling,</br>He made all the darkness depart!</br></br>Chorus</br>Heaven came down and glory filled my soul,</br>When at the cross the saviour made me whole;</br>My sins were washed away,</br>And my night was turned to day,</br>Heaven came down and glory filled my soul!</br></br>2. Born of the Spirit with life from above,</br>Into God’s family divine;</br>Justified fully thro’ Calvary’s love,</br>O what a standing is mine!</br>And the transaction so quickly was made,</br>When as a sinner I came,</br>Took of the offer of grace He did proffer,</br>He save me, O praise His dear name!</br></br>3. Now I’ve a hope that will surely endure,</br>After the passing of time;</br>I have a future in heaven for sure,</br>There in those mansions sublime.</br>And it’s because of that wonderful day,</br>When at the cross I believed;</br>Riches eternal and blessing supernal,</br>From His precious hand I received.</br>
title: HEAVEN CAME DOWN

content: ( Folliot S. Pierpoint )</br>1. For the beauty of the earth,</br>For the golory of the skies,</br>For the love which from our birth</br>Over and around us lies,</br>Lord of all, to Thee we raise</br>This our grateful song  of praise.</br></br>2. For the joy of human love,</br>Brother, sister, parent, child,</br>Friends on earth and Friend above,</br>Pleasures pure and undefiled,</br>Lord of all, to Thee we raise </br>This our grateful son of praise.</br></br>3. For the gift of Thy dear Son,</br>For the hope of heaven at last,</br>For the Spirit’s victory won,</br>For the crown when life is past,</br>Lord of all, to Thee we raise</br>Songs of gratitude and praise.</br>
title: FOR THE BEAUTY OF THE EARTH

content: ( Adelaide Pollard)</br>1. Have thine own way, Lord! Have</br>Thine own way!</br>Thou art the potter, I am the clay.</br>Mold me and make me after Thy will,</br>While I am waiting yielded and still.</br></br>2. Have Thine own way, Lord! Have </br>Thine own way!</br>Search  me and try me, Master, today!</br>Whiter than snow, Lord, wash me just now,</br>As in Thy presence Humbly I bow.</br></br>3. Have Thine own way, Lord! Have </br>Thine own way!</br>Wounded and weary Help me, I  pray!</br>Power—all power---Surely in Thine!</br>Touch me and heal me, Saviour divine!</br></br>4. Have Thine own way, Lord! Have</br>Thine own way!</br>Hold o’er my being absolute sway!</br>Fill with Thy Spirit till all shall see</br>Christ only, always, living in me!</br>
title: HAVE OWN WAY, LORD

content: (Knowles Shaw)</br>1. Sowing in the morning, sowing seeds of kindness,</br>Sowing in the noontide and the dewy eve;</br>Waiting for the harvest, and the time of reaping,</br>We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves.</br></br>Chorus</br>Bringing in the sheaves</br>Bringing in the sheaves</br>We shall come rejoicing,</br>Bringing in the sheaves</br>Bringing in the sheaves</br>Bringing in the sheaves</br>We shall come rejoicing,</br>Bringing in the sheaves</br></br>2.  Sowing in the sunshine, sowing in the shadows,</br>Fearing neither clouds nor winter’s chilling breezes;</br>By and by the harvest, and the labour ended,</br>We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves.</br></br>3. Going forth with weeping, sowing for the Master,</br>Though the loss sustained our spirit often grieves;</br>When our weeping’s over, He will bid us welcome,</br>We shall come rejoicing, bringing in the sheaves.</br>
title: BRINGING IN THE SHEAVES

content: (Johnson Oatman Jr)</br>1. I’m pressing on the upward way,</br>New heights I’m gaining every day;</br>Still praying as I onward bound,</br>“Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.”</br></br>Chorus</br>Lord, life me up, and I shall stand</br>By faith, on heaven’s stableland;</br>A higher plane that I have found;</br>Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.</br></br>2. My heart has no desire to stay,</br>Where doubts arise and fears dismay,</br>Though some may dwell where these abound,</br>My prayer, my aim is higher ground.</br></br>3. I want to live above the world,</br>Though Satan’s darts at me are hurled;</br>For faith has caught the joyful sound,</br>The song of saints on higher ground.</br></br>4. I want to scale the utmost height,</br>And catch a gleam of glory bright;</br>But still I’ll pray till heaven I’ve found</br>“Lord, lead me on to higher ground.”</br>
title: HIGHER GROUND

content: (Robert Lowry)</br>1. Shall we gather at the river</br>Where bright angel feet have trod,</br>With it’s crystal tide forever</br>Flowing by the throne of God?</br></br>Chorus</br>Yes, we’ll gather at the river,</br>The beautiful, the beautiful river;</br>Gather with the saints at the river,</br>That flows by the throne of God.</br></br>2. On the margin of the river,</br>Washing up its silver spray;</br>We will walk and worship ever,</br>All the happy golden day.</br></br>3. Ere we reach the shining river,</br>Lay we every burden down;</br>Grace our spirits will deliver,</br>And provide a robe and crown.</br></br>4. Soon we’ll reach the shinning river,</br>Soon our pilgrimage will cease;</br>Soon our happy hearts will quiver</br>With the melody of peace.</br>
title: SHALL WE GATHER AT THE RIVER

content: (William McComb)</br>1. Chief of sinners though I be,</br>Jesus shed His blood for me;</br>Died that I might live on high,</br>Died that I might never die;</br>As the branch is to the vine,</br>I am His, and He is mine.</br></br>2. O the height of Jesus’  love!</br>Higher than the heaven above,</br>Deeper than the deepest sea,</br>Lasting as eternity;</br>Love that found me—wondrous thought!</br>Found me when I sought Him not!</br></br>3. Chief of sinners though I be,</br>Christ is all in all to me;</br>All my wants to Him are known,</br>All my sorrows are His own;</br>Safe with Him from earthly strife,</br>He sustains the hidden life.</br>
title: CHIEF OF SINNERS

content: 1. In the morning when I rise,</br>In the morning when I rise,</br>In the morning when I rise,</br>Give me Jesus.</br></br>Chorus</br>Give me Jesus, Give me Jesus,</br>You may have all this world,</br>Give me Jesus.</br></br>2. Dark midnight was my cry,</br>Dark midnight was my cry</br>Dark midnight was my cry.</br>Give me Jesus.</br></br>3. Just about the break of day,</br>Just about the break of day,</br>Just about the break of day,</br>Give me Jesus.</br></br>4. Oh, when I come to die,</br>Oh, when I come to die</br>Oh, when I come to die</br>Give me Jesus.</br>
title: GIVE ME JESUS

content: ( Anne Steele)</br>1. My Maker and my King,</br>To Thee my all I owe;</br>Thy sovereign bounty is the spring</br>Whence al my blessing flow;</br>Thy sovereign bounty is the spring</br>Whence all my blessing.</br></br>2. The creature of Thy hand.</br>On Thee alone I live;</br>My God, Thy benefits demand</br>More praise than I can give.</br>My God, Thy benefits demand</br>More praise than I can give.</br></br>3. Lord, what can I impart</br>When all is Thine before?</br>Thy love demands a thankful heart;</br>The gift, alas! How poor.</br>Thy love demands a thankful heart;</br>The gift, alas! How poor.</br></br>4. O! let Thy grace inspire</br>My soul with strength divine;</br>Let every word and each desire</br>And all my days be Thine.</br>Let every word and each desire</br>And all my days be Thine.</br>
title: MY MAKER AND MY KING

content: (Isaac Watts;ref by Ralph E. Hudson)</br>1. Alas, and did my Saviour bleed?</br>And did my Soverign die?</br>Would He devote that sacred head for such a worm as I?</br></br>Chorus </br>At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light,</br>And the burden of my heart rolled away,</br>It was there by faith I received my sight,</br>And now I am happy all the day!</br></br>2. Was it for crimes that I have done,</br>He suffered on the tree?</br>Amazing pity! Grace unknown! And love beyond degree!</br></br>3. But drops of grief can ne’er repay </br>The debt of love I owe:</br>Here, Lord, I give myself away, ‘Tis all that I can do!</br>
title: AT THE CROSS

content: (Henry F. Lyte)</br>1. Abide with me; fast falls the even- tide;</br>The darkness deepens; Lord with me abide!</br>When other helpers fail and comforts flee,</br>Help of the helpless, O abide with me!</br></br>2. Swift to its close ebbs out life’s little day;</br>Earth’s joys grow dim, its glories pass away;</br>Change and decay in all around I see;</br>O Thou, who changest not, abide with me!</br></br>3. I need Thy presence every passing hour;</br>What, but Thy grace, can foil the temper’s power?</br>Who, like Thyself, my guide and stay can be?</br>Through cloud and sunshine, O abide with me!</br></br>4. I fear to foe, with Thee at hand to bless;</br>Ills have no weight, and tears to bitterness</br>Where is death’s sing? Where,</br>Grave, thy victory?</br>I triumph still if Thou abide with me!</br>
title: ABIDE WITH ME

content: (Reginald Heber)</br>1. Holy, holy, holy! Lord God Almighty!</br>Early in the morning our song shall rise to Thee;</br>Holy, holy, holy! Merciful and mighty!</br>God in three persons, blessed Trinity!</br></br>2. Holy, holy, holy! Angels adore Thee,</br>Casting down their bright crowns around the glassy sea;</br>Thousands and ten thousands worship low before Thee,</br>Which wert, and art, and evermore shalt be.</br></br>3. Holy, holy, holy! Though darkness hide Thee,</br>Though the eye of man Thy great glory may not see;</br>Only Thou art holy; there is none beside Thee,</br>Perfect in power, in love and purity.</br>
title: HOLY, HOLY, HOLY

content: (Francis Ridley Havergal)</br>1. Like a river glorious is God’s perfect peace,</br>Over all victorious in its bright</br> increase;</br>perfect, yet it floweth fuller every </br>day,</br>Perfect, yet it groweth deeper all the way.</br></br>Chorus</br>Trusting in Jehovah, Hearts are fully blest—</br>Finding, as He promised, perfect peace and rest.</br></br>2. Hidden in the hollow of His blessed hand,</br>Never foe can follow, never traitor stand;</br>Not a surge of worry, not a shade of care,</br>Not a blast of hurry touch the spirit there.</br></br>3. Every joy or testing comes from God above,</br>Given to His children as an act of love;</br>We may trust Him fully—all for us to do—</br>Those who trust Him wholly, find </br>Him wholly true.</br>
title: LIKE A RIVER GLORIOUS

content: (J. G. Small)</br>1. I’ve found a Friend; oh such a Friend!</br>He loved me ere I knew Him;</br>He drew me with the cords of love,</br>And thus He bound me to Him.</br>And ‘round my heart still closely twine</br>Those ties which nought can sever,</br>For I am His, and He is mine,</br>Forever, and forever,</br></br>2. I’ve found a Friend; oh such a Friend!</br>He bled, He died to save me;</br>And not alone the gift of life,</br>But His own self He gave me.</br>Nought that I have my own I call</br>I hold it for the Giver;</br>My heart, my strength , my life, my all,</br>Are His, and His forever,</br></br>3. I’ve found a Friend; oh such a Friend!</br>All power to Him is given;</br>To guard me on my upwardcourse,</br>And bring me safe to heaven.</br>The eternal glories gleam afar,</br>To nerve my faint endeavor;</br>So now, to watch, to work, to war, </br>And then to rest forever.</br></br>4. I’ve found a friend; oh such a Friend!</br>So kind, and true, and tender;</br>So wise a counselor and guide,</br>So mighty defender.</br>From Him, who loveth me so well,</br>What power my soul can sever?</br>Shall life or death, or earth, or hell?</br>No; I am His forever.</br>
title: I’VE FOUND A FRIEND

content: (Anna B. Warner)</br>1. Jesus loves me! This I know,</br>For the Bible tells me so;</br>Little ones to Him belong,</br>They are weak, but He is strong.</br></br>Chorus</br>Yes, Jesus loves me!</br>Yes, Jesus loves me!</br>Yes, Jesus loves me!</br>The Bible tells me so.</br></br>2. Jesus loves me! He who died</br>Heaven’s gate to open wide;</br>He will wash away my sin,</br>Let His little child come in.</br></br>3. Jesus, take this heart of mine,</br>Make it pure and wholly Thine;</br>On the Cross You died for me,</br>I will love and live for Thee.</br>
title: JESUS LOVES ME

content: (William O. Cushing)</br>1. There’ll be no dark valley when Jesus comes,</br>There’ll be no dark valley when Jesus comes,</br>There’ll be no dark valley when Jesus comes</br>To gather His loved ones home.</br></br>Chorus</br>To gather His loved ones home,</br>To gather His loved ones home,</br>There’ll be no dark valley when Jesus comes</br>To gather His loved ones home.</br></br>2. There’ll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes,</br>There’ll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes,</br>There’ll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes</br>To gather His loved ones home.</br></br>3. There’ll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes,</br>There’ll be songs of greeting hen Jesus comes,</br>There’ll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes,</br>To gather His loved ones home.</br></br>
title: THERE’LL BE  NO DARK VALLEY

content: (Mary A. Lathbury)</br>1. Break Thou the bread of life,</br>Dear Lord, to me,</br>As Thou didst break the loaves</br>Beside the sea;</br>Beyond the sacred page</br>I seek Thee, Lord;</br>My spirit pants for Thee,</br>O living Word.</br></br>2. Bless Thou the truth, dear Lord,</br>To me, to me,</br>As Thou didst bless the bread</br>By Galilee;</br>Then shall all bondage cease,</br>All fetters fall;</br>And I shall find my peace,</br>My all in all.</br></br>3. Spirit and life are they,</br>Words Thou dost speak;</br>I hasten to obey,</br>But I am weak;</br>Thou art my only help,</br>Thou art my life;</br>Heeding Thy holy Word</br>I win the strife.</br>
title: BREAK THOU THE BREAD OF LIFE

content: Malachi 3:17 (William O. Cushing)</br>1. When He cometh, when He cometh</br>To make up His jewels,</br>All His jewels, precious jewels,</br>His loved and His own.</br></br>Chorus</br>Like the stars of the morning,</br>His bright crown adorning,</br>They shall shine in their beauty,</br>Bright gems for His crown.</br></br>2. He will gather, He will gather </br>The gems for His Kingdom,</br>All the pure ones, all the bright ones,</br>His loved and His own.</br></br>3. Little children, little children</br>Who love their Redeemer,</br>Are the jewels, precious jewels,</br>His loved and His own.</br>
title: WHEN HE COMETH

content: (Fanny J. Crosby)</br>1. Jesus, keep me near the cross;</br>There a precious fountain</br>Free to all, a healing stream,</br>Flows from Calvary’s</br></br>Chorus</br>In the cross, in the cross,</br>Be my glory ever,</br>Till my raptured soul shall find</br>Rest beyond the river.</br></br>2. Near the cross, a trembling soul,</br>Love and mercy found me;</br>There the bright and Morning Star</br>Sheds its beams around me.</br></br>3. Near the cross! O Lamb of God</br>Bring its scenes before me;</br>Help me walk from day to day,</br>With its shadows o’er me.</br></br>4. Near the cross I’ll watch and wait,</br>Hoping, trusting ever,</br>Till I reach the golden strand,</br>Just beyond the river.</br>
title: NEAR THE CROSS

content: (John Fawcett)</br>1. Blest be the tie that binds</br>Our hearts in Christian love!</br>The fellowship of kindred minds</br>Is like to that above.</br></br>2. Before our Father’s throne,</br>We pour our ardent prayers;</br>Our fears, our hopes, our aims  are one,</br>Our comforts and our cares.</br></br>3. We share our mutual woes</br>Our mutual burdens bear,</br>And often for each other flows</br>The sympathizing tear.</br></br>4. When we asunder part,</br>It gives us inward pain;</br>But we shall still be joined in heart,</br>And hope to meet again.</br>
title: BLEST BE THE TIE THAT BINDS

content: (Franklin E. Belden)</br>1. O there’ll be joy when the work is done,</br>Joy when the reapers gather home,</br>Bringing the sheaves at set of sun </br>To the New Jerusalem.</br></br>Chorus</br>Joy, joy, there’ll be joy by and by.</br>Joy, joy, where the joys never die;</br>Joy, joy for, for the day draweth night</br>When the workers gather home.</br></br>2. Sweet are the songs that we hope to sing,</br>Grateful the thanks our hearts shall bring,</br>Praising forever Christ our King </br>In the New Jerusalem.</br></br>3. Pure are the joys that await us there,</br>Many the golden mansions fair;</br>Jesus Himself doth them prepare,</br>In the New Jerusalem.</br>
title: JOY BY AND BY

content: Ex. 25:22                 (Hugh Stowell)</br>1. From every stormy wind that blows,</br>From every swelling tide of woes,</br>There is a calm, a sure retreat;</br>‘Tis found beneath the mercy seat.</br></br>2. there is a place where Jesus sheds</br>The oil of gladness on our heads,</br>A place than all besides more sweet;</br>it is the blood-bought mercy seat.</br></br>3. There is a scene where spirits blend,</br>Where friend holds fellowship with friend;</br>Thought sundered far, by faith they meet</br>Around one common mercy seat.</br></br>4. There, there, one angel’s wings we soar,</br>And earthly cares molest no more,</br>And heaven comes down our souls to greet,</br>And glory crowns the mercy seat.</br></br>5. Ah! Whither should we flee for aid,</br>When tempted, desolate, dismayed?</br>Or how the hosts of sin defeat,</br>Had suffering saints no mercy seat?</br>
title: FROM EVERY STROMY WIND

content: (Horatio G. Spafford)</br>1.  When peace, like river, attendeth my way,</br>When sorrows like sea billows roll—</br>What ever my lot, Thou hast taught me to say,</br>It is well, it is well with my soul.</br></br>Chorus</br>It is well with my soul, it is well,</br>It is well with my soul.</br></br>2. My sin—O the joy of this glorious thought—</br>My sin, not in part, but the whole, </br>Is nailed to the cross, and I bear it no more:</br>Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, O my soul</br></br>3. And, Lord, haste the day when my faith shall be signt,</br>The clouds be rolled back as a scroll:</br>The trump shall resound and the </br>Lord shall descend,</br>“Even so---“ it is well with my soul.</br>
title: IT IS WELL WITH MY SOUL

content: Deut.33:25                  (Caroline Sandell Berg)</br>1. Day by day and with each passing moment,</br>Strength I find to meet my trials here,</br>Trusting in my Father’s wise bestowment,</br>I’ve no cause for worry or for fear.</br>He whose heart is kind beyond all measure.</br>Gives unto each day what He deems best.</br>Lovingly, its part of pain and pleasure,</br>Mingling toil with peace and rest.</br></br>2. Every day the Lord Himself is near me</br>With a special mercy for each hour;</br>All my cares He fain would bear, and cheer me,</br>He whose name is Counselor and power.</br>The protection of His child and treasure</br>Is a charge that on Himself He laid;</br>As your days, your strength  shall be in measure,</br>This the pledge to me He made.</br></br>3. Help me, then, in every tribulation</br>so to trust thy promises, O Lord,</br>That I lost not faith’s sweet consolation</br>Offered me within Thy holy Word.</br>Help me Lord, when toil and trouble meeting,</br>E’er to take, as from a Father’s hand</br>One by one, the days, the moments fleeting,</br>Till I reach the promised land.</br>
title: DAY BY DAY

content: 1. content: (Franklin E. Belden)</br>1. “Tis love that makes us happy,</br>‘tis love that smooth the way;</br>It helps us “Mind” it makes us kind </br>To others every day.</br></br>Chorus</br>God is love, we’re His little children</br>God is love, we would be like Him.</br>‘Tis love that smooth the way;</br>It helps us “mind” it makes us kind</br>To others every day.</br></br>2. This world is full of sorrow,</br>Of sickness, death and sin;</br>With loving heart we’ll do our part</br>And try some soul to win.</br></br>3. And when this life is over, </br>And we are called above,</br>Our song shall be, eternally,</br>Of Jesus and His love.</br>
title: TIS LOVE THAT MAKES US HAPPY

content: (Samuel Stennet)</br>1. On Jordan’s stormy banks I stand,</br>And cast as wishful eye</br>To canaan’s fair and happy land,</br>Where my possessions lie.</br></br>Chorus</br>I am bound for the promised land.</br>I am bound for the promised land,</br>O who will come and go with me?</br>I am bound for the promised land.</br></br>2. O’er all those wide extended plaints </br>Shines one eternal day;</br>There, Christ, the Sun, forever reigns,</br>And scatters night away.</br></br>3. When I shall reach that happly place,</br>And be forever blest?</br>When shall I see my Father’s face,</br>And in His kingdom rest?</br></br>4. Filled with delight, my raptured soul</br>Would here no longer stay;</br>Though Jordan’s waves around me roll,</br>Fearless, I’d launch away.</br>
title: On Jordan’s stormy banks

content: 1. We are climbing Jacbo’s ladder.</br>We are climbing Jacob’s ladder.</br>We are climbing Jacob’s ladder</br>Soldiers of the cross.</br></br>2. Every round  goes higher, higher,</br>Every round goes higher, higher.</br>Every round goes higher, higher,</br>Soldiers of the cross.</br></br>3. Sinner,do you love my Jesus?</br>Sinner,do you love my Jesus?</br>Sinner,do you love my Jesus?</br>Soldiers of the cross.</br></br>4. If you love Him, why not serve Him?</br>If You love Him, why not serve Him?</br>If you love Him, why not serve Him?</br>Soldiers of the cross.</br>

content: (Ida A. Guirey)</br>1. Jesus, Rose of Sharon, bloom with-in my heart;</br>Beauties of Thy truth and holiness impart,</br>That whatee’er I got my life may shed abroad.</br>Fragrance of the knowledge of the love of God.</br></br>Chorus</br>Je-sus-ross of Shar-on—</br>Bloom in radiance and in love with in my heart.</br></br>2. Jesus, Rose of Sharon, sweeter far to me.</br>Than the fairest flow’rs of earth could ever be,</br>Fill my life completely, adding more each day,</br>Of Thy grace divine and purity I pray.</br></br>3. Jesus, Rose of Sharon, balm for ev’ry ill,</br>May Thy tender mercy’s healing pow’r distil</br>For afflicted souls of weary,</br>Burdened men,</br>Giving needy mortals health and hope again.</br>
title: JESUS, ROSE OF SHARON

content: II Chron 29:14     (William Walsham How)</br>1. We give Thee but Thine own,</br>Whate’er the gift may be;</br>All that we have in Thine alone,</br>A trust, O Lord, from Thee.</br></br>2. May we Thy bounties thus </br>As stewards true receive,</br>And gladly, as Thou blessest us,</br>To Thee our first-fruits give.</br></br>3. And we believe Thy word,</br>Though dim our faith may be,</br>Whate’er for Thine we don, O Lord, </br>We do it unto Thee.</br></br>
title: WE GIVE THEE BUT THING OWN

content: (Daniel Iverson)</br>Spirit of the living God, Fall afresh on me!</br>Spirit of the living God, Fall afresh on me!</br>Break me, melt me, mold me, fill me!</br>Spirit of the living God, fall afresh on me!</br>
title: SPIRIT OF THE LIVING GOD

content: (William Cowper)</br>1. O, for a closer walk with God!</br>A calm and heavenly frame,</br>A light to shine upon the road </br>That leads me to the Lamb.</br></br>2. Return, O Holy Dove! Return,</br>Sweet messenger of rest;</br>I hate the sins that made Thee mourn,</br>And drove Thee from my breast.</br></br>3. What peaceful hours I once enjoyed!</br>How sweet their memory still!</br>But they have left an aching void</br>The world can nev’er fill.</br></br>4. The dearest idol I have known,</br>Whate’er that idol be,</br>Help me to tear it from Thy throne</br>And worship only Thee.</br>
title: O FOR A CLOSER WALK WITH

content: (Edward Caswell)</br>1. When morning gilds the skies,</br>My heart awaking cries,</br>May Jesus Christ be praised!</br>Alike at work and prayer,</br>To Jesus I repair;</br>May Jesus Christ be praised!</br></br>2. Whene’er the sweet church bell Peals over hill and dell,</br>May Jesus Christ be praised!</br>O hark to what its sings,</br>As joyously it rings,</br>May Jesus Christ be praise!</br></br>3. The night becomes as day,</br>When from the heart we say,</br>May Jesus Christ be praised!</br>The powers of darkness fear,</br>When this sweet chant they hear,</br>May Jesus Christ be praised!</br></br>4. Be this, while life is mine,</br>My canticle divine,</br>May Jesus Christ be praised!</br>Be this th ‘eternal song</br>Through all the ages long,</br>May Jesus Christ be praised!.</br>
title: WHEN MORNING GILDS THE SKIES

content: (Elisha Albright Hoffman)</br>1. Have you been Jesus for the cleaning pow’r?</br>Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?</br>Are you fully trusting in His grace this hour?</br>Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?</br></br>Chorus</br>Are you washed in the blood,</br>In the soul-cleansing blood of the Lamb?</br>Are your garments spotless? Are they white as snow?</br>Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?</br></br>2. Are you walking daily by the Savior’s side?</br>Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?</br>Do you rest each moment in the Crucified?</br>Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?</br></br>3. When the Bridegroom cometh will your robes be white!</br>Are your washed in the blood of the Lamb?</br>Will your soul be ready for His presence bright,</br>And be washed in the blood of the Lamb?</br></br>4. Lay aside the garments that are stained with sin,</br>And be washed in the blood of the Lamb;</br>There’s a fountain flowing for the soul unclean,</br>O be washed in the blood of the Lamb.</br>
